loans.name: Santa De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Santa De Los Ángeles es madre de familia y esta solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de una barda alrededor de su casa. 
Ya que le preocupa la seguridad y la protección que tiene sus hijos cuando están en su casa; porque ella sale muy temprano a trabajar, en la limpieza de unas oficinas y de casa particulares. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida y que si patrimonio este en mejores condiciones. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilla y arena, quien se encargara de realizar la mejora es su esposo.
texts.en: Santa de los Ángeles is a mother who is asking for a loan to erect a wall around her house because she’s concerned about security and protection for her children when they are home because she leaves for work very early; she works cleaning offices and private homes.  She wants to improve her quality of life and the conditions of her property.  She’s asking for the loan to buy building materials like concrete blocks, cement, rebar and sand.  Her husband will do the work.

loans.use: to erect a front wall.

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es:
La Sra. Marilú, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, su edad es 52 años y tiene 05 hijos, que ya no están a su cargo porque se sostienen solos.
 La señora Marilú, siempre ayudó a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, con la venta de abarrotes en su casa ayudó con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos, que ahora ya son profesionales, pero dejó el negocio por motivos económicos. Desde hace tres años, al ingresar a su banquito, que decidió reiniciar un nuevo negocio para generar sus propios ingresos, es así que con el primer préstamo que recibió compró madera, y su esposo la ayudó fabricando sillas, stands y mesas, que ella vendía, y duplicó sus ganancias, esto le sirvió para comprar una máquina de coser, donde confeccionaba vestidos y salía a venderlos, es así como iba juntando dinero para comprar vitrinas, mesa y cumplir con su sueño de volver a implementar una tienda de abarrotes para poder trabajar desde sus casa, 
Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00, compró productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, jabón, detergente, etc.) para  implementar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, que es lo que siempre quiso tener un negocio que pudiera realizarlo desde su casa.
Marilú, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora,  su sueño es que su familia esté más unida en el futuro y además seguir implementando su negocio, para incrementar sus ganancias, y satisfacer las necesidades de sus nuevos clientes. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por los valores que les viene impartiendo como son la responsabilidad y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Marilú belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II” (Women of the Hill II) communal bank in La Banda de Shilcayo District, San Martín Province and Department.  She’s 52 years old, married and has five children who are no longer in her care because they support themselves.

Marilú always helped her husband with household expenses selling groceries at home.  She helped pay for her children’s schooling and they are all now professionals.  She left the business due to economic reasons.  For the last three years since joining the communal bank she decided to start a new business to earn her own income.  This is how she used her the first loan she got to buy lumber.  Her husband helped her to manufacture chairs, stands and tables that she’d sell.  She doubled her profits.  This helped her buy a sewing machine that she used to make dresses that she’d go out to sell.  This is how she gradually saved up money to buy display cases and tables to reach her dream of once again opening a grocery store so that she could work from home.

She will use this 2000 sol loan to buy basic staple items (rice, sugar, milk, oil, soap, detergent, etc.) to set up a small grocery store which is what she’s always wanted to have: a business she could run from home.

Marilú is a hardworking, tenacious woman.  Her dream is that her family is more united in the future and that she can continue to equip her store to increase profits and meet the needs of new customers.  She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for the values it’s imparting like responsibility and mutual support.

loans.use: to buy groceries (basic staple items).

loans.name: Elza

texts.es:
La Sra. Elza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 36 años, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo de once años que está estudiando el nivel primario.
Siempre vivió en el campo ayudando a sus padres junto a su esposo, cuando su hijo creció y tenía que ir al escuela salieron a vivir a la ciudad, es cuando se ve en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijo lavando ropa de sus vecinos , hace tres años que viene trabajando con su Banquito comunal, con su primer préstamo compró una parrilla para vender asados a la parrilla por las noches, y por las mañanas realizaba la compra y venta de productos agrícolas en el mercado de la ciudad como, plátano, granos( frijol, cacao, maíz, café) para seguir generando ingresos para contribuir con la economía de su hogar y la educación de su hijo.   .
Con este préstamo de S/.1,300.00, comprará  productos agrícolas (plátano, cacao, maíz, frijol) para su venta de las mañanas e insumos para preparar juanes asados a la parrilla y juanes para la venta de las noches.
Elza,  es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda ofrecer diversidad de productos para mantener contentos a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia, y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de seguir generando sus propios ingresos y además de apoyarlas con los diferentes temas de capacitación que reciben.
texts.en:
Elza belongs to the Mujeres de la Colinia II communal bank.  It is in the La Banda de Silcayo district, San Martin province, San Martin Department.  She is 36 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has an 11 year old son who attends elementary school.

She always lived in the countryside helping her parents along with her husband.  When her son got older and had to go to school they left to live in the city.  That is when she found herself needing to generate her own income by washing her neighbors’ clothes.  She does this to support her husband with her son's education

She has been working with her communal bank for three years.  With her first loan she bought a grill to sell food that is roasted on the grill in the evenings.  In the mornings she buys and sells farming products at a market in the city.  She buys things like bananas and grains (bean, cacao, corn, and coffee) in order to continue generating income to contribute financially to her household and her son’s education.

She will use the 1,300 soles from this loan to buy farming products (bananas, cacao, corn, and beans) in order to sell them in the mornings.  She will also use them as ingredients to prepare “juanes” (seasoned rice wrapped in a green bijao leaf. Seasoning typically includes turmeric and cumin, giving the rice a warm flavor and a yellowish color. Most juanes also contain a small piece of chicken, a slice of egg and an olive or two), roasted on the grill  to sell at night.

Elza is a tenacious and enterprising woman.  Her dream is to have a grocery store where she could offer diverse products to keep her customers happy and to generate income for her family.  She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to continue generating her own income.  She is also grateful for the support the members receive through various trainings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La Sra. Edelmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, su edad es 46 años y no tiene hijos a su cargo pues todos son mayores y ya han formaron sus hogares.
Decidió iniciar su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con la crianza de sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos, empezó vendiendo abarrotes y golosinas en su casa, pero al ser abatida por una enfermedad que necesitaba tratamiento en la capital, y no tener  quien se hiciera cargo de su negocio, hizo que decayera, es así que al regresar ya recuperada una amiga le invita a participar del Banquito y de esta manera obtiene su primer préstamo S/.300.00 más sus ahorros le sirvió para comprar sábanas. Actualmente incrementó su mercadería con edredones y cobertores, para mantener satisfechos a sus clientes que son amigos y comerciantes de su localidad. Ella está muy contenta porque puede seguir generando sus propios ingresos y por eso le pone mucho empeño a este negocio. 
Con este préstamo de S/.800.00,  comprará sábanas, edredones y cobertores, para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, que se encuentran contentos por la calidad del producto.
Edelmira, es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora,  su sueño es contar con un local bien ubicado e implementado donde pueda continuar vendiendo su mercadería (sábanas, edredones, cobertores y toallas, etc.), está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades de la vida.
texts.en:
Edelmira is a member of the 'Mujeres de la Colina II' community bank which is based in La Banda de Shilcayo district, in San Martín province, in San Martín department.  She is 46 years old, married, and doesn't have any children in her care as they are all grown up and have formed their own households.

Edelmira decided to start her business in order to help her husband raise their children and have her own income.  She started out selling groceries and candies in her home but she suffered an illness which needed treatment in the capital city and didn't have anybody to look after her business.  This meant that her business declined.  On her return, recovered from her illness, a friend invited her to join her community bank.  Edelmira obtained her first loan for 300 soles which she put together with her savings and bought some sheets.  She then increased her merchandise with comforters and bedspreads in order to keep her customers satisfied.  Her customers are friends and shopkeepers in her town.

Edelmira is very happy because she is able to continue making her own income and, for this reason, she puts a lot of effort into her business.  She will use this loan for 800 soles to buy sheets, comforters and bedspreads so that she can fill her customers orders.  Her customers are happy with the quality of the products she offers.

Edelmira is a tenacious and hard-working woman.  Her dream is to have well-located and equipped business premises where she can continue selling her merchandise (sheets, comforters, bedspreads, towels, etc.).  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to get ahead in spite of life's adversities.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters and bedspreads

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, el mayor ya es independiente y la segunda estudia el nivel inicial.
Siempre le gustó generar sus propios ingresos, para ayudar a su esposo, que trabaja en construcción civil, con los gastos de su hogar y los estudios de su hijo mayor, es así como el primer préstamo que recibió del banquito comunal lo destinó para comprar frutas y venderlas en la vereda de su casa, le fue bien por un año, hasta que la competencia abrió una tienda de comestibles donde adicionaron la venta de frutas y verduras, es por ello que decide cambiar de negocio por el de alquiler de mototaxi, donde recibe diariamente el pago, para ahorrar y le da tiempo para dedicarse a otras labores como es el cuidado de niños en su casa. Es así como viene luchando día a día, junto a su esposo para salir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,  lo utilizará para dar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil y dar la inicial para adquirir otro, que le permitirá tener más ganancias y ahorrar para terminar de construir su casa. 
Rosa Mercedes, es una mujer luchadora que tiene muchas ganas de seguir aprendiendo, su sueño es terminar de construir su casa,  para implementar una tienda de venta de frutas de todas la Regiones del Perú. Por todo eso agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, porque le da la oportunidad de seguir adquiriendo nuevos conocimientos para aplicarlos en su vida cotidiana
texts.en:
Rosa Mercedes is a member of the “Mujeres de la Colina II” community bank in Tarapoto district, in Tarapoto province, in San Martín department.  She is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  Her eldest child lives independently and her youngest is in elementary school.

Rosa Mercedes has always enjoyed earning her own income to help her husband, who works in the house-building trade, with their household expenses and the education expenses of their eldest child.  She used the first loan that she received through her community bank to buy fruit which she sold on the sidewalk outside her house.  Things went well for a year, until the competition opened a grocery store in which they also started selling fruit and vegetables.  For this reason, she decided to change business and she now hires out a motorcycle taxi.  She receives payment every day and is thereby able to save.  She also has time to spend on other tasks such as looking after children in her home.  In this way, Rosa Mercedes works hard, day by day, alongside her husband, so that they can get ahead and make their dreams come true.

Rosa Mercedes will use this loan for 2,000 soles to have her vehicle serviced and make a down payment to acquire another one.  This will allow her to make more profits and save up so that she can finish building her house.  Rosa Mercedes is a tenacious woman who has a great desire to continue learning.  Her dream is to finish building her home and to set up a store where she will sell fruit from every region in Peru.  She thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for all this because they give her the opportunity to continue acquiring new knowledge to apply to her daily life.

loans.use: to have her vehicle serviced

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Adilia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de  San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. De estado civil conviviente, su edad es 42 años y tiene 03 hijos, el mayor ya es independiente y los dos últimos estudian el nivel Secundario y Primario respectivamente.
Cuando vió la necesidad de seguir creciendo con la actividad que realizaba su esposo, el de renovación de calzados, decidió poner su granito de arena, para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia,  con el primer préstamo que recibió del banquito comunal le sirvió para comprar materiales para la confección de calzados como zapatos, sandalias, que ella salía a vender ambulatoriamente y con el tiempo el negocio se volvió familiar, al implementar un local donde confeccionaban los calzados y lo exhibían, fue un gran éxito, y en la actualidad cuentan con el apoyo de su hijo mayor que se encarga de los diseños de nuevos productos como botas para diferentes ocasiones como actuaciones, presentaciones, etc. Es así como vienen trabajando para seguir creciendo, y atendiendo los pedidos de sus clientes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,  comprará  materiales como suelas, cuero, cartón, pegamento y bicuero, para cumplir con los pedidos que tienen pendiente por las fiestas Navideñas.
Adilia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,  que sueña con tener una fábrica de confección de calzados, para  de esta manera asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por las enseñanzas impartidas a las socias en el buen manejo del dinero con responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Adilia belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II”, communal bank, in La Banda de Shilcayo district, in the province of San Martín, in San Martín department.   She is 42, lives with her partner, and has three children. The eldest is already independent, and the youngest ones are in high school and primary school respectively.  

When she saw the need to keep her husband's shoe repair business growing, she decided to do her bit to improve the family's financial situation. She used the first loan she received from the communal bank to buy materials for making footwear, such as shoes and sandals, which she went out to sell as a street vendor. 

In time, it became a family business, when they set up a shop where they made and displayed footwear. It was a great success, and they currently have their eldest son's help, as he is the one responsible for the design of new products, such as boots for various occasions such as performances and shows.

This is the way they have been working to keep growing, and filling their customers' orders. With this loan of 2,000 soles she will buy materials such as shoe soles, leather, cardboard, glue and two-toned leather, in order to fill pending orders for the Christmas holidays. 

Adilia is an enterprising and hard-working woman, who dreams of having a factory for making footwear, to assure her children's future in this way. 

She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the instruction given to the members on managing their money responsibly.

loans.use: To buy materials such as shoe soles, leather, cardboard, glue, and two- toned leather.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Su estado civil conviviente, de 43 años de edad y tiene 03 hijos, de los cuales uno ya formó su hogar, dos están a su cargo y están estudiando el nivel superior y secundario.
Con la finalidad de apoyar en los gastos económicos de su hogar, al ingresar al banquito con el préstamo de S/.300.00, que le dieron decidió reparar un mototaxi que fue de sus esposo,  para alquilarlo y de esa manera recibir diariamente su pago, con el tiempo ahorró y solicitó un nuevo préstamo en su banquito, de esa manera compró otra unidad móvil. Actualmente viene generando sus propios ingresos y de esa forma ayuda a su esposo que es Albañil, con los gastos de su hogar. 
Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00,  lo utilizará para dar mantenimiento y renovación de llantas de sus vehículos motorizados, para seguir incrementando sus ganancias.
Rosa, es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es poner un negocio de venta de ropa  y  de esta manera seguir contribuyente con la economía de su hogar, por todo ello, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de seguir desarrollando sus capacidades, y ayudarle a hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosa  belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II” communal bank, in La Banda de Shilcayo district, in the province of San Martín, in San Martín department.

She is 43, and lives with her partner. She has three children, one of whom has already started their own household. Two are in her care, and go to technical college and high school.

Aiming to help with household expenses, when she joined the communal bank and was given a loan of 300 soles, she decided to repair a mototaxi that belonged to her husband. This was in order to rent it out, and that way receive a daily payment. 

In time, she saved up, and applied for another loan at her communal bank. That's how she bought another motorized vehicle. 

Now she is generating her own income, and in that way helping her husband who is a construction worker, with the household expenses. 

She will use this loan of 2,000 soles, to do maintenance and replace the tires on her motorized vehicles, in order to continue increasing her earnings. 

Rosa is a very determined woman. Her dream is to set up a business selling clothing, and in this way continue contributing to the household finances. 

For all this, she is thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos; for giving her the opportunity to continue developing her abilities, and helping her make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: To maintain motorized vehicles.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. De estado civil conviviente, su edad es 39 años y tiene 03 hijos de 22, 20 y 08 años de los cuales sólo el último está a su cargo y está estudiando el nivel primario..
Con tres hijos a que mantener y con el sueldo de su esposo que no alcanzaba para solventar los gastos de su hogar, hace doce años decidió vender productos de belleza por catálogo con un capital de S/.600.00, le fue bien por el empeño que le puso, desde hace cuatro años que viene formando parte del Banquito que le ayuda a capitalizarse para iniciar con la venta de nuevos productos que sus clientes necesitan . También cuenta con una buena clientela pues les brinda un trato amable.
Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00,  comprará productos naturales, mercadería como ropa y productos de belleza para la campaña navideña. 
Julia, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,  su sueño es implementar un Spa, donde ella pueda aplicar los conocimientos que viene recibiendo, de los productos de belleza que comercializa, para seguir generando sus propios ingresos y así mismo está muy agradecida por el apoyo que viene recibiendo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con los préstamos y orientaciones que recibe.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II” communal bank, in La Banda de Shilcayo district, in the province of San Martín, in San Martín department. 

She is 39, and lives with her partner. She has three children, ages 22, 20, and 8, of whom only the youngest is in her care, and attends primary school. 

With three children to support, and with her husband's salary not being enough to pay the household expenses, she decided 12 years ago to sell beauty products by catalogue. She did this with 600 soles of capital. It went well, because of the effort she put into it. 

She has been part of the communal bank for four years, which helps her obtain working capital, so that she can start selling new products that her customers need. As well, she has a good clientele, as she provides them with friendly service. 

With this loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy natural products, as well as merchandise such as clothing and beauty products for the Christmas sales season.  

Julia is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Her dream is to open a spa, where she can apply the knowledge she has been acquiring about the beauty products she sells. This will enable her to continue generating her own income. 

Thus she is very grateful for the support she has been receiving from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, through the loans and the orientation that she receives.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos.  Vive en Paiján, perteneciente al departamento de La Libertad, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

María se dedica a la venta de ropa, juguetes, útiles escolares y otros accesorios para el hogar.  Esto a través de una bodega instalada en su propio domicilio.  María tiene mucha clientela, la cual acude a su bodega por el buen servicio que da, además de la calidad de los productos que vende.  Con los ingresos que percibe en su negocio, cubre sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

María desea adquirir más mercadería para abastecer a su bodega y así tener variedad de productos para ofrecer a su público, es por ello, que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María is 52, a widow, and has three children. She lives in Paiján, which is part of La Libertad department, and is located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque department. 

María sells clothing, toys, school supplies, and products for the home. She does this through a small general store set up in her home.  María has many customers, who come to her store because of the good service she gives, and the quality of the products she sells

With the income she earns in her business, she covers her personal expenses and those of her family. María wishes to acquire more merchandise for stocking her store, and in order to have a variety of products to offer her customers.  

That is why, in order to achieve her objective, she felt it advisable to obtain a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Richar Alexander

texts.es:
Richar tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente con un hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa familiar con sus padres, la casa está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte céntrica de este distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos. Su padre dueño de la casa y de una parcela agrícola firma como aval en el presente crédito.

La actividad que desarrolla Richard es el transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, en la cual trabaja  diariamente.  Cuando llega la campaña de mango trabaja en una fábrica de procesamiento de la fruta de mango, en donde le pagan quincenalmente. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Richar desea repotenciar su mototaxi para poder trabajar óptimamente, ya que a la fecha por el uso se ha deteriorado y necesita algunas refacciones.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Richar is 29 years old. He lives with his partner and has a son in his care. He lives in the family home with his parents. The house is located in Tambogrande district. He lives in the central part of this district, and has basic services. His father owns the house and a parcel of farmland, and is co-signing this loan. 

Richar transports passengers in his mototaxi, and works at this daily. When the mango season comes, he works in a factory that processes mango fruit, where they pay every two weeks. 

With his earnings he covers his personal expenses, and those of his family.  Richar wishes to overhaul his mototaxi so that it can perform optimally, since it has deteriorated through use and needs some repairs. This is why he has decided to obtain a loan of 1000 nuevos soles at Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To overhaul his mototaxi.

loans.name: Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Semirames trabajaba como ayudante en el restaurante de un sobrino con el tiempo dejo el negocio debido a un viaje, durante algún tiempo ella se dedico a otra cosa, pero después de un tiempo retomo el negocio del restaurante para trabajar en el alquilo nuevamente el local y así empezó por su propia cuenta poco a poco fue ganado su propia clientela ya tiene en su negocio cerca de un año, actualmente ella sola cocina, atiende y realiza todas las labores ahora que su negocio ha crecido esta en búsqueda de una persona que la ayude por que ya no puede abastecerse sola, en su restaurante vende diversos platos de comida criolla menú y platos a la carta por las mañanas también prepara desayunos su negocio ha mejorado mucho por eso que quiere  formalizarlo para ofrecer una buena atención a sus clientes, gracias a su trabajo ha podido surgir y darle a su hijo comodidad y estudios. su préstamo le va a servir para comprar los insumos que necesita para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz,aceites, azúcar etc. que es lo básico para la preparación de los alimentos que vende, Semirames es integrante del grupo “ TODO LO PUEDO EN CRISTO” lo conforman 07 socias que viven en el Callao zona costera del Perú.
* Semirames es la cuarta de las paradas (derecha) viste polo guinda.
texts.en:
Semirames used to work as a helper in a nephew's restaurant. In time, she left the business due to a trip. For some time she worked at something else. But after a time she took up the restaurant business again, and started to work in it.  

She rented the premises again, and so began on her own account. Little by little, she started winning her own clientele. She has been in her business for close to a year now. 

Currently, she cooks on her own, serves customers, and does all the work. Now that her restaurant has grown, she is seeking a person to help her, because now she can't run it alone.

She sells various traditional dishes in her restaurant, a meal of the day, and a la carte dishes. In the mornings she also prepares breakfasts. Her business has really improved. That's why she wants to formalize it, so that she can offer good service to her customers. 

Thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead, and provide her son with schooling  and the comfort of a home. She is going to use the loan to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare the food, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar etc., which are basics for the preparation of the food she sells. 

Semirames is the fourth person standing, and is wearing a cherry-coloured T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer mayor con sus 56 años aun sigue trabajando incansablemente, fue su madre quien también se dedicaba al mismo oficio que le enseño a preparar diversos alimentos ahora ella se dedica a la venta de comidas es pensionista de trabajadores que laboran en diversas fabricas, los demás días que las fabricas no trabajan  prepara alimentos al paso como tamales, papas rellenas los que ofrece por la zona que vive, son muchas personas que le compran por que conocen su sazón, durante algún tiempo su trabajo fue de mucha ayuda para la manutención de su hogar debido a que su esposo no tenia un trabajo estable asi pudo darle estudios a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, el dinero de su préstamo la ayuda mucho para poder comprar los insumos que necesita como arroz,fideos,menestras etc. así puede ahorrar un poco mas otra parte lo utilizara para mejorar sus utensilios de cocina para una buena presentación ante sus clientes, en el futuro le gustaría tener un negocio formal un lugar cómodo y bonito donde pueda vender los platos que prepara . En la actualidad es la presidenta del grupo “AMIGAS UNIDAS”.
Nancy esta vestida con blusa roja.
texts.en:
Nancy is a woman of 56, who still continues working tirelessly. It was her mother, who worked in the same trade, who taught her to prepare different foods. 

Now she serves meals. She provides meals to workers in various factories. On the days the factories don't operate, she prepares fast food such as tamales, and stuffed potatoes, that she sells around the area where she lives. A lot of people buy from her, because they know how tasty her food is.

For some time, her work was a great help in supporting the household, as her husband didn't have a steady job. This way she was able to send her children to school, and improve her house. 

The money from her loan really helps her buy the ingredients she needs, such as rice, noodles, and legumes; and this way she can save a little more. 

She will use another portion of the loan to improve her kitchen utensils, to present a good appearance for her customers. In the future she would like to have a regular business in a nice, comfortable place, where she can sell the dishes she prepares. 

Currently, she is the president of the "Amigas Unidas" communal bank. Nancy is wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, legumes, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Juliet is 49-years-old and lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta City. She is married with 1 child. 

Juliet has a business where she sells clothes and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan  of 10,000 PHP to purchase more clothes to sell.
 
Juliet has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Julieta hopes to have merchandise to earn more money to save for the children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is married with 4 children. Flordeliza is 40-years-old and lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Flordeliza sells cospachem (health) products to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. Each month she earns 10000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 25000 PHP to purchase cospachem to sell/retail.

Flordeliza has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cospachem (health) to sell/retail.

loans.name: Mirah Rose

texts.en:
Mirah Rose is 28-years-old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mirah Rose is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feed and additional pigs to raise.

Mirah Rose has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a beauty salon.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 34 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two children.

Luzvilla sells okay-okay (secondhand clothing) as her business and earns approximately 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

Luzvilla became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Myrachel

texts.en:
Myrachel is 21 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Myrachel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell.
Myrachel has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and also earns an income from retailing frozen foods and beauty products.
Myrachel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda is 64 years old and a widow with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Fredeswinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fredeswinda has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dreams: to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a married woman with four children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Adelaida earns a living by selling Ready-To-Wear clothes, like mens and ladies shirts and jeans. She also sells bags. 

Adelaida earns about 10000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as shirts, jeans and slippers. 

Adelaida hopes this loan will help grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shirts, jeans and slippers

loans.name: Mariefel

texts.en:
Mariefel is married with one child. She is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Mariefel is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan to buy piglets for her hog raising business.
Mariefel has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and become a supplier of pork meat in town.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a 30-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 11 years old.

Benita and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. They earn 7000 PHP per month with this business. 

Benita does her best to support her husband and children. She applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. 

Benita hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Rocelo

texts.en:
Rocelo is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Rocelo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He personally buys stocks or goods using his motorbike. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rocelo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. 

Artemio has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Artemio has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has four children, the oldest of whom is 19 years old.

Elma has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for quite some time now. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, canned goods, soap and shampoo. Elma's income from the store helps buy her family's daily needs. She said that sometimes her store gets empty and she is left with no income, but she finds ways to get back on track again.

Elma has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo. She hopes for her business to grow and for her children to finish college and become successful.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph  is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Joseph  has a shop that sells  firewood. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of firewood to sell.

Joseph  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joseph  hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Emelita has a poultry house and she raises & sells chickens. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy feed for the chickens.

Emelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Francisca has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Francisca has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Francisca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Tita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Tita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Tita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 11 children. 

Merly has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy a stock of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.

Merly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Merle has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy a stock of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.

Merle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Emelia has a corn field, and she sells corn grains during harvest time. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers for her corn field.

Emelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her corn field.

loans.name: Mariyana

texts.en:
Mariyana, 35 years old, lives in Pejarakan village, North of Bali. She lives near the beach where most of the community work as a fisherman or salt farmers. But she chose a different business. 

Mariyana has a small kiosk and also does travelling vegetable sales. Her husband works as boat driver at Menjangan resort. To improve her business, she took out a loan from MUK for Rp.10.000.000. This loan will be used to buy a lot of merchandise to fill her kiosk. She has a dream for it to become the largest kiosk in her village and that she can provide the needs of the community there.

loans.use: To buy a lot of merchandise.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rachel has a shop that sells coconuts & green bananas. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Rachel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rachel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated with four children. 

Edgar has a food shop that sells viands like chicken barbecue, fried chicken & "halang-halang". He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Edgar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edgar hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Elsa has a shop that sells green bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Sriani

texts.en:
Sriani is a 53-year-old widow. Her husband passed away in 2001. She has six children, namely:  Fredy, 33, married; Andri 30; Rino 29; Triyanto, 28; Mariana, 27; Yuliastuti, 23; all working and Twistin, 21, studying at a university in Java Island. 

Being a single parent does not make Sri despair; she has taken over the responsibility as the breadwinner for her family and for Twistin’s education fees. To make a living, Sriani sells a traditional snack originally from Java Island, called “rempeyek” - made of chopped peanuts, rice flour, salt and celery. 

Currently, Sriani wants to improve her business. Actually, her children are willing to support her business but she does not want to lean on them. She would like to request a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000 to purchase two frying pans and two stoves to support her business. She also plans to buy two goats to be fattened and resold. She hopes TLM will approve her loan application as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase two frying pans, two stoves and two goats to be fattened.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a rice trader. Her husband is a farmer. Two of her children are employed overseas; her son works as construction worker in Thailand and her daughter works as homemaker in Malaysia. 

Sokha requests a loan of USD 1000 to purchase rice to store in a warehouse to sell when the price is higher. By doing so, she can make more profit than usual.

In the future, she would like to run a rice store at home, build a new house, and support her children to study the Korean language in order to find a job in Korea.

loans.use: to purchase rice to store in a warehouse to sell when the price is higher.

loans.name: Devi

texts.en:
Devi is a 23-year-old lady who is married to Mariones, a 28-year-old laborer. They are blessed with two sons, named: Diego, 5, and Figo, 3.

To supplement her husband’s income, Devi runs a small kiosk business specially selling various vegetables such as "kangkung" (water spinach), mustard greens, cassava leaves, eggplant, onions, etc and various cakes such as fried bread with refined sugar, "kue bendera" made of coconut milk, rice flour, wheat, sugar and food coloring as well as other cakes. Besides selling them in her small kiosk, Devi also offers her cakes to other kiosks owners and school canteens. 
 
Devy is planning to buy more vegetables and produce more cakes but due to capital limitations she is seeking a loan for her business improvement. One day, she met a TLM loan officer; she got information on TLM’s Individual Lending Program. She is interested in joining the program and is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. She is expecting that TLM will be willing to assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and to produce more cakes

loans.name: Lambertus

texts.en:
Lambertus is a 35-year-old man and is married to Maria, a 32-year-old lady. They have been blessed with one daughter, Anggi, 10, who is studying in the 5th grade of elementary school.

Lambertus is a fisherman; he is very enthusiastic in doing his job. He usually catches fish in the afternoon and returns home in the next morning using his boat. Lambertus also employs two assistants to help him. 

Currently Lambertus cannot catch fish since his boat is damaged. For that reason Lambertus is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. He would like to spend the loan on machine tools to repair his boat and a new trawl since the old one is no longer feasible to use. He is hoping that TLM will help him through the loan.

loans.use: to buy machine tools to repair his boat and a new trawl.

loans.name: Melianus

texts.en:
Melianus is a 34-year-old man, married to Orance, a 31-year-old lady. They have two children, namely: Irfan, 6, in the 1st grade of elementary school and Aurel, 9 months. Melianus and family are living in a rented house.

Melianus is a fishmonger; he sells fish from one house to another by using the motorbike that he bought after saving his money for 5 years. 

In order to improve his business,  Melianus is seeking a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. He would like to spend the loan on more fish as demanded by his customers, fish such as: mottled, sardines, tuna, etc. He is hoping that TLM is willing to help him with the capital. He is expecting that the loan from TLM would bring a better life for his family to enable him to cover his family needs and the children's educational fees in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, e.g.: mottled, sardines, tuna, etc.

loans.name: Marga Indah Ternak Group

texts.en:
The Marga Indah Ternak group is located at Pemuteran village, in the north of Bali. This area is an expansion of service area from MUK branch in Singaraja, North Bali. The group has 10 members and all are woman. Their daily work is as farmers, but to supplement their income, they decided to run a pig business at home.

Ni Komang, the head of the group, already has pigs. To improve the business, she needs a loan and training from MUK. The loan will be used to purchase superior piglets and good quality food. She desires a better result. All the profit will be used to pay school fees. One of the member couldn't attend the meeting because she had given birth.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets and good quality food.

loans.name: Srey Touch

texts.en:
Srey Touch, 50, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a wood trader. Her husband raises animals to sell. 

Srey Touch requests a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase an engine to install a new bamboo train in order to carry wood to sell. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business selling wood and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase an engine to install a new bamboo train in order to carry wood to sell.

loans.name: Nengsy

texts.en:
Nengsy is a 29-year-old widow. She is living with her son, Ronald, 11, who is in the 6th grade of elementary school. Her husband passed away in 2006 because of a sickness. Since then, she took over her husband’s role in covering their daily needs. 

Nengsy owns a business selling kerosene; she initiated the business in 2007 using her own capital. Every week, Nengsy buys kerosene from the Kerosene-Base Agent and then resells it to her customers. Besides selling kerosene, Nengsy also sells mobile phone recharges. From the income generated she is able to pay house her rental fee, daily needs and the educational fees of her son. 

Currently Nengsy dreams of improving her business by adding more stock of kerosene. This situation led her to seek a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She would like to buy 1000 liters of kerosene. She is optimistic that it can be sold out quickly particularly before Christmas Day as the customers need it to cook food and bake cakes and pastries.

loans.use: To purchase 1000 liters of kerosene.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is a 48-year-old man and is married to Rosalina, a 48-year-old lady. Adam is a headman in his village. They have been blessed with six children. They are: Wellem, 26; Saul, a 24-year-old university student; Admin, 20, graduated from senior high school; Victor, 18, attending a technical high school; Monika, 11, attending elementary school and Randy, 6, attending kindergarten.

Adam has a kiosk business selling various daily needs, i.e: instant noodles, coffee, sandals, ketchup, cooking oil, some snacks, etc. Adam has been engaged in the business for the past three years. Adam is grateful since the business enables him to finance his family's daily needs and education fees for his children. 

Adam was thinking to improve his business by adding a greater variety of stock, i.e.: wheat flour, margarine, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, rice, etc. He got information that TLM provides the individual Lending Program for small entrepreneurs like him. He then submitted the loan application and is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000. He is hoping that his loan application will be approved by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of stock such as wheat flour, margarine, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, rice, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 53-year-old widow; her husband passed away 12 years ago. In order to cover her living expenses, Gina sells various household appliances (stoves, shoes, rice cookers, pillows etc). She has been involved in the business for five years. 

Since Christmas Day is coming, Gina plans to sell women's shoes in large quantity, ovens, bed springs and bracelets. Unfortunately she does not have enough capital to do so. She would like to request a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She is really hoping that TLM is willing to assist her with the loan for her business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase women's shoes in large quantity, stoves, bed springs and bracelets to resell.

loans.name: Firmine

texts.en:
Firmine is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has six children.
 
Firmine has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. He has had this business for five years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Firmine has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Firmine hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, 42, is married to Markus, 44. From the marriage she has four children. They are: Lexy, 22, and Lydia, 19, both attending University, Nushin, 11, and Ishak, 8, both at elementary school. 

Magdalena owns a kiosk business selling nine daily basic needs items, cigarettes and some snacks. Her business has been running for four years. Magdalena operates the business to assist her husband in generating more income as her husband’s income as a farmer is insufficient to cover their daily living expenses. 

Magdalene was thinking to try another business by raising chickens but she does not have money to do so. Fortunately, she met a Field Officer and got an explanation of TLM’s Individual Lending Program. She thought this is a good opportunity for her to initiate a new business. She then submitted the loan application to TLM and requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She plans to spend the loan on chicks and feed for them. She is expecting that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Simech

texts.en:
Simech, 43, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She runs a grocery store, rents CDs, and produces traditional cakes to sell. Her husband is in the army. 

Simech requests a loan of USD 400 to purchase more groceries to sell. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business of raising pigs and sell all kinds of animal medicine and vaccine, build new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jeanry

texts.en:
Jeanry is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Jeanry has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Jeanry has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jeanry hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children.
 
Lydia has a shop that buys and sells coconuts after making them into copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She has had this business for seven years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts to sell.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has four children.
 
Rita has a shop that sells coconuts and bananas. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts and bananas.

Rita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children.
 
Nenita has a shop that sells vegetables and flowers during harvest time. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for flower and vegetable gardens.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for flower and vegetable gardens.

loans.name: Lanibelle

texts.en:
Lanibelle is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Lanibelle has a shop that sells coconuts and bananas. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Lanibelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lanibelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Paul provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Paul has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Paul hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle service.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Annabelle has a vegetable garden that sells vegetables like string beans and eggplants during harvest time. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

Annabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Marilyn has a rice field that  provides unhulled rice to sell  during harvest time. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Благодаря кредиту КИВА, который Валентина получила в прошлом году и вложила в улучшение условий в своих теплицах, она смогла содержать теплицы и увеличить свой доход за год с 70 000 гривен до 85 000 гривен. 
Следующей сезон будет для Валентины непростым, так как тепличный бизнес снова требует новых вложений: Валентине нужно достроить одну теплицу и переделать еще одну. Более того Валентина хочет закупить качественные семена, уголь и подкупить пленку. 
Благодаря полученной от прошлого сезона прибыли, Валентина и ее семья смогли позволить себе сделать дома небольшой ремонт, вставить новые окна, приобрести подержанный автомобиль ВАЗ 2106.
7 лет назад от Валентины ушел муж, все это время она справлялась сама. Сейчас вырос и женился сын, поэтому работают в теплицах теперь уже вместе с сыном и невесткой.
texts.en:
Thanks to the loan from Kiva that Valentina received last year and which she used to improve the conditions of her greenhouses, Valentine was able to maintain her greenhouses and increase her yearly income from 70,000 to 85,000 Grivnyas.
The next season will not be an easy one for Valentina, as her greenhouse business calls for new investments again: Valentina needs to finish building one greenhouse and to alter another one.  Valentina would also like to buy good-quality seeds, coal, and additional quantities of protective film.
Thanks to the profits made last season, Valentina and her family have been able to afford small home repairs, install new windows, and buy a used car, a VAZ-2106 (Lada). Valentina's husband left her seven years ago, and she has coped by herself since then.   Her son is now grown-up and married, and Valentina, her son and daughter-in-law all work together on the greenhouses.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, protective film, and coal.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en: Manvel is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. Manvel has been engaged in agriculture for many years, through which he has managed to expand his farm. Now Manvel would like to develop cattle-breeding. With the help of this loan Manvel will increase the number of the livestock. This will allow Manvel to increase his income and savings to renovate his house. House renovation means improved living conditions for Manvel and his family. Manvel lives together with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandchild.

loans.use: to pay for livestock

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Прошлый кредит Владимир использовал на постройку дополнительной теплицы. К сожалению, из-за того, что в прошлом сезоне помидоры созрели позднее ожидаемого срока и урожай запоздал, доход Владимира не увеличился и он был вынужден продавать овощи по более низкой цене. Наученный горьким опытом, Владимир планирует в этом году своевременно провести отопление в теплицах. Для этого ему и нужны дополнительные средства от КИВА. Владимир планирует провести 3 фазы и установить электрокотел на несколько теплиц.
В семье у Владимира все без изменений. Недавно в доме Владимир сделал пристройку для ванной комнаты, делает там ремонт.
Кроме огорода Владимир занимается торговлей кормами для животных, имеет дома хранилище для кормов.
texts.en:
Vladimir used the previous loan to build an additional greenhoues. Unfortunately due to the fact that last season the tomatoes ripened later than was expected and the harvest was late Vladimir's income has not increased and he was forced to sell vegetables at a lower price. Taught by bitter experience Vladimir is planning to install heating equipment in the greenhouses in time this year. To do this he needs additional funds from Kiva. Vladimir is planning to install a 3-phase and an electric boiler in several greenhouses.

There are no changes in Vladimir's family. Recently in his house Vladimir made ​​an addition for the bathroom and is doing repairs there.

In addition to the garden Vladimir is selling animal fodder and has a storage for that at home.

loans.use: to install heating equipment in the greenhouses.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 53-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a food stall where she sells viands. Erlinda also decided to sell school supplies to her community. Erlinda earns 5000 PHP per month with her business. She would like to request a loan to buy more school supplies and snacks to sell. Erlinda hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for all her children to be able to go to college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 47 years old and is a married woman with six children. She has been engaged in farming for six years. Judith grows rice crops to sell to her community. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items like coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap and canned goods.

Judith is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell like canned goods. Judith hopes to help improve her family's living situation through her income. She also hopes for her children to finish college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell like canned goods.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.ru:
Олег использовал предыдущий кредит для разведения цыплят и смог неплохо заработать.
В этот раз кредит в 7 000 гривен ему необходим для того, чтобы отремонтировать автомобиль и приобрести зимние колеса и все необходимое для предоставления транспортных услуг зимой. Когда наступают холода, этот бизнес становится главным источником дохода для Олега и его семьи. 
Олег надеется, что, получив кредит от Кива, он сможет без проблем работать на своем транспортном средстве на протяжении холодов, тем самым стабильно обеспечивая свою семью.
texts.en: Oleg used his previous loan for breeding chickens and earned good money. This time, he is requesting a loan of 7,000 hryvnia to repair his car and put on winter tires and do everything necessary in order to be able to offer winter transportation services. When the cold season begins, this business becomes a major source of income for Oleg and his family. Oleg hopes that by receiving a Kiva loan, he can easily work on his car during cold weather, therefore providing a stable income for his family.

loans.use: repair his car, put on winter tires and do everything necessary in order to be able to offer winter transportation services

loans.name: Vorntha

texts.en:
Vorntha, 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Her husband is a barber. Vorntha requests a loan of USD 700 to purchase bricks and other construction materials to build a fence around her house to prevent animals from getting in. 

In the future, she would like to improve her husband's work to be more modern by using new and modern equipment. She hopes to build a new house and send her children to a good school. 

Note: Vorntha is not in this photo. this man in the photo is Vorntha's husband.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and other construction materials to build a fence.

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 11 Group

texts.en:
Nuraini is a mother of two children.  She has been selling cell phone minute refills for two years from her house. Her business is going well and she has a lot of customers. This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She plans to use this loan to buy more cel phone minute refills to sell. Her husband is a container driver. Her income can contribute to her husband's income to buy food and pay for the children's school fee. She likes selling cell phone minute refills because it is practical and easy even though the income is not too big.

In the future, she hopes she can have a bigger stall and have more customers. By doing this, she hopes she can have enough savings to continuously send her children to school.

Other group members use their loan to improve their business selling clothes on credit and selling nasi uduk.

loans.use: to pay for more cell phone minute refills to sell

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда использовала предыдущий кредит КИВА для того, чтобы приобрести полиэтиленовую пленку и семена для своих теплиц. 
В этот раз она снова обращается в КИВА, так как ей нужны дополнительные средства на содержание теплиц и выращивания овощей в этом сезоне, а именно: 10 000 гривен на семена, 5 000 гривен на капельное орошение и еще 
5 000 гривен на закупку пленки.
В этом году дочь поступила учиться в ВУЗ в Запорожье, ушло много средств на поступление и на проживание.
texts.en:
Nadezhda used her previous Kiva loan to buy polyethylene sheeting and seeds for her greenhouses.  She is turning to Kiva once again because she need an additional 10,000 UAH for seeds, 5,000 UAH for drip irrigation, and 5,000 UAH to buy sheeting so she can maintain her greenhouses and raise the season's vegetables.

This year her daughter started college in Zaporizhzhya, and the application and housing expenses have been extremely costly.

loans.use: to expand her greenhouses and buy seeds for the next growing season.

loans.name: Adol

texts.en:
Adol is 30 years old, married, and has three children. All of them attend school. She has food stall in Bor, South Sudan which has been running for two years.

Adol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell.

loans.name: Lailatul

texts.en:
Lailatul is a 42-year-old widow who is living with three children, namely: Rifky, 12; Rebecca, 11 and Rizal, 8; they are at elementary school. Lailatul runs a beauty salon business. From the business Lailatul is able to finance her family’s life and the education fees of her children.

Lailatul has been involved in the business since 2007. Prior to running the business, Lailatul attended beauty training, sponsored by the local government. She initiated the business by using her own savings. In this business Lailatul provides hair cuts, cream baths and facials. She offers the services at a reasonable price so the customers like to come to her beauty salon. 

Lailatul needs more capital to improve her business; therefore she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,000,000 to add more beauty care treatments such as waxing and hair straightening cream. She also wants to buy more products such as curly cream, shampoo, conditioner, hair coloring cream, etc. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as curly cream, shampoo, conditioner, hair coloring cream, etc.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is engaged in agriculture. Unable to insure enough income by selling fruits from her orchard, Gohar would like to sell more fruits. She has applied for a loan to purchase more fruits, keep them in the freezer and sell them during winter. This will allow Gohar to save money and use it next year to develop her orchard making it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for fruits

location.town: Nor Dvin village of Ararat region

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida, 36, is married, and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fortune-teller. Her husband is a construction foreman. Lida is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase construction materials to expand her husband’s business. 

In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business of construction work by purchasing more construction supplies in order to have enough material for mega costruction. This would allow her to build new house and support her child to study in higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Nyantur

texts.en:
Nyantur is 32 years old, married, and has three children. All of them attend school. She has a food stall in Bor, South Sudan, which she has been running for eight years. 

Nyantur is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 24 years old and is a married woman with a one-year-old child. Her husband is a farmer. To earn a living, she sells banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramel) and other delicacies to her community. She started her business a year ago. 

Julita is requesting a loan to buy more bananas, oil, and sticks. Julita hopes to have a stable business in the future. She also desires to make improvements to her family's house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, oil, and sticks

loans.name: Clem Karl

texts.en:
This is Karl, 22, a resident of Paliparan Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. Single, he is working hard to provide for his daily expenses and also to help his parents and siblings.

Karl makes a living by selling jewelry, cell phones, ready-to-wear products and other merchandise. He has been in this business for four years and is very knowledgeable about the preferences of his customers, most of whom are students and young people. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is applying for a loan of 15,000 PHP. He will be using the money to buy more products to sell. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business. 

Karl dreams of being successful in his business. As a CCT community partner, he faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products and other items needed in his business.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Ngasapisa Mhekela Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 34-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is attending primary education. She has done well growing maize and beans for over twelve years. However, she has failed to improve her farming activities due to lack of fertilizers and insecticides.

Mary is working hard to find capital for buying fertilizers and insecticides. She also dreams to expend her scale of production from three to nine acres within the next five years. She wishes to have a good house and private transport, such as a motorbike.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Julita runs a sari-sari (general) store. She sells items like vinegar, soy sauce, shampoo and soap. She also bakes bread that she sells to her community. 

Julita has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar and more items to sell. Julita hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for bright futures for her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and more items to sell

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Sokea, 44, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is on the staff of the Provincial Inspection Department. Her husband is a security guard in a hotel and also a farmer. Her child is on the staff of the Provincial Religious Affairs Department. 

Sokea requests a loan of $500 to purchase seed rice and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season. By doing so, she can generate more income to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to raise animals in order to generate more income and build a new home.

loans.use: to purchase rice and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season

loans.name: Akauny

texts.en:
Akauny is a 29-year-old married woman with no children. For two years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan. 

Akauny is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchaase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 28 years old and is married with an 8-year-old child. For the past eight years, he has worked as a farmer in Trinidad, Bohol. Nestor primarily grows rice crops to sell and he earns about 6,000 PHP per month from farming. Nestor also owns a sari-sari (variety) store business that his wife manages. They sell various items like shampoo, soap, coffee, vinegar, and sugar.

Nestor is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and more items, such as canned goods, to sell at his store. In the future, he hopes to earn more and be able to make a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and items to sell at his store

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira lives with her husband and children. She has been engaged in agriculture for already eleven years. Naira is currently renovating her house to improve her family's living conditions, and the current income she gets is not enough to cover agricultural costs. Thus Naira has applied for a loan. With the requested loan Naira plans to purchase fuel and polyethylene coating for the glasshouse. Naira will develop agriculture to insure a sustainable future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and polyethylene coating

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie, who is 32 and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is a local policeman and the father of their two children who are already in grade school. Margie, together with her husband and children, manages her household while operating a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Margie earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Margie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help continue to operate her business. She will use her loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Margie fervently hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies and graduate one day. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends her group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy items and products to sell

loans.name: Phallim

texts.en:
Phallim is 36 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Phallim raises pigs at home and her husband is a pig vendor. 

Phallim is requesting a 700 USD loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to transport pigs to sell. With a motorbike, her husband can more easily carry pigs to market and generate more income to support the family. In the future, Phallim would like to expand her husband’s pig-selling business, renovate her house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport pigs

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 29-year-old married man with two children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For the past five years, he has been working in the agricultural sector. Godfrey's major business challenge is seasonality.

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy beans to plant. In the future, his dream is to venture into mechanized farming.

loans.use: to buy beans to plant

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine operates a food stall to earn a living.  The 39-year-old lady is married and has two children, aged 4 and 7.  Catherine has employed two people to assist her in her business.  She works hard in her business so as to improve her living standards.  She has requested for 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to renovate her business premises.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
В прошлом году Ольга использовала кредит КИВА для устройства полива и постройки дополнительной теплицы. Она получила хороший доход, приобрела рядом небольшой участок земли и теперь строит на нем еще две дополнительные теплицы.
В семье и дома у Ольги все без изменений. Старшая дочь в этом году заканчивает школу.
