В этот раз Ольге необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы установить капельное орошение - 3 000 гривен, закупить семена на 8 500 гривен и удобрения на 3 500 гривен.
В жизни Ольги было немало горя. Когда она потеряла первого муж, через три года она снова вышла замуж во второй раз. С этим мужем она живет в браке уже 14 лет. Муж во всем помогает Ольге с тепличным бизнесом.
texts.en:
Last year Olga used her Kiva loan for a watering system and another greenhouse.  She made a nice income and bought a small piece of land nearby, on which she's now putting up two more greenhouses.  There haven't been any changes to Olga's home or family.  This year her oldest daughter is finishing school.

Olga currently needs a loan of 15,000 UAH, including 3,000 UAH for a watering system, 8,500 UAH for seeds, and 3,500 for fertilizer.

Olga has had a great deal of grief in her life.  She lost her first husband, and remarried three years later.  She's been with her current husband for fourteen years, and he helps her out with her greenhouse business.

loans.use: to put in a watering system and buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sakti Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Dahlia is a mother of two children. She is pictured wearing a red dress. She has been selling fried snacks from her house since 2006. She also sells daily basic needs such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, etc. She wants to produce and sell more varieties of fried snacks, so she is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, and oil. Her husband is a security guard. Her husband's income can cover daily meals and she helps her husband to generate income for her children's school fees. She likes to sell fried snacks because people like it and every day her products are sold out even though there are so many competitors.

In the future, she wants to have a general store to generate income to have savings to send her children to University.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients such as flour, sugar and oil to make more fried snacks

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a 47-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 24 years old and her husband works as a farmer and an official in Barangay. For the past 11 years, Saturnina has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells items such as coffee, shampoo, soap, canned goods and soft drinks. She works hard to help support her family. 

Saturnina is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, toilet paper, and coffee. In the future, she hopes to have more income.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soft drinks, toilet paper, and coffee

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann, 57, is a widower and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer. All of his children are employed as garment workers. Vann requests a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work. By doing so, his children can easily go to work on time. In the future, he would like to run a sewing shop for his children to sew at home and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, 33, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Mary Ann earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mary Ann hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have another extension of her store. Her desire is also to help her siblings finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a married man living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He has 2 children, ages 18 and 16.

Leonardo is a seaweed farmer. Through this business, he is able to provide for his family's needs and send his children to school. Leonardo works hard to improve his income and continue supporting his family.

Leonardo has requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, nylon and other materials. Leonardo plans to make improvements to their house soon.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, nylon and other materials

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel is a 40-year-old, married woman with six children; all of them attend school. For 4 years, Nyiel has run a hotel in Bor, South Sudan.

Nyiel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en: Nduku is 40 years old, married, and has four children. To earn a living, she runs a cafeteria. She has been in the business for three years and has employed two people.  She also does livestock farming to supplement her income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans easily which has helped her to grow her business.  She has requested for 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to renovate her business premises and buy ingredients such as sugar, maize flour, rice, and cooking fat.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises and buy ingredients such as sugar, maize flour, rice, and cooking fat

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en: Margarit is engaged in agriculture. Margarit needs an investment to develop cattle-breeding. With the requested loan she plans to purchase cattle and hay. Additional cattle will allow Margarit to get more income from agriculture by selling milk and expanding the farm further. With additional income Margarit will renovate her house and improve her household economy. Margarit lives together with her husband, mother-in-law, and children.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and hay

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn, 39, is married, resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Her husband is a palm fruit and palm juice vendor. Two of her children are employed as garment workers. Sokhorn requests a loan of USD 700 to run a new business of selling groceries at home. Currently, she haven't had grocery store yet. She will start her new business of selling grocery after she gets this loan. By doing so, she can generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to build a concrete grocery store, a toilet, and a kitchen, and support her children to study higher, especially English language.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire workers

loans.name: Zenona

texts.en:
Zenona is a 57-year-old widow who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living selling food to her community and she cooks and sells food items. Zenona works hard to support her children.

Zenona is requesting a loan to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables, and spices. In the future, she hopes to have stable business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables, and spices

loans.name: Abadi Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Ita is pictured in the middle holding a plate of roti betawi (an Indonesian snack). She is 37 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are still in school. She has been selling roti betawi since 1998 from her house and trusted stalls around her neighborhood. The business is running smoothly. That is why she is taking her first loan from VisionFund Indonesia to expand her business. She will use this loan to pay for more ingredients like flour, coconut, and sugar to make more roti betawi.

In the future, she plans to have her own stall and have enough savings to send her children to University.

Other group members are using their part of the loan to improve their business including a general store, selling nasi uduk and selling gado-gado (a vegetable salad served with a peanut sauce dressing).

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients like flour, coconut and sugar to make roti betawi (Indonesian snack)

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
This is Maxima, who is 53. She is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. Maxima is married to Fortunato, a carpenter, and is the  mother to their six children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating her business. Maxima works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Maxima make a living by selling ornamental plants. Filipinos love to arrange different types of ornamental plants for the beautification of their homes and backyards, and Maxima has gardening experience planting different kinds of ornamental plants. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and nearby community members. Maxima has been in this business for ten years and she earns a minimum of 270 PHP daily. 

Maxima is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help continue operating her business. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer, pots, seedlings, wires, and plastics. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

 As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends her group's weekly fellowship* meetings where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy gardening items needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks

loans.name: Kavling Jaya Group

texts.en:
Djuniara is 48 years old. She is married but she doesn't have any children. She has been selling daily basic needs for two years from her house. Her business is going well but she wants to sell more variety of merchandise such as instant noodles, coffee, sugar and rice. That is why she is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She hopes she can have her own store and sell more merchandise.

Other group members are using their part of the loan to improve their business, which include selling snacks and selling clothes on credit.

loans.use: to pay for more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is 38 years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are in school. For the past three years, Achol has run a bookshop in South Sudan.

Achol is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase textbooks to sell. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She owns a carpentry shop that has been in operation for the last eleven years. She is married and has five school-going children. Ruth learned of Milango from her relatives and joined to access funding for her business.

Ruth is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillinges (KES) to purchase timber and cushions. She is often faced with lack of capital. Ruth will use the extra income from this loan to meet the family’s basic needs.

Ruth’s ambition is to have a large-scale carpentry shop, which will enable her to supply school and office tenders.

loans.use: To purchase timber and cushions.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Upendo Mhekela Group

texts.en:
Lusiana is a 54-year-old married woman with one child. She has been a coffee farmer for over 20 years. She has been challenged by lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. She has also started a business of buying and selling fish. 

Lusiana seeks a loan to pay for fertilizers and insecticides for her crops. Also she is thinking of increasing her scale of production from 13 to 22 acres in five years to come. By expanding her scale of production, she will be able to pay medical expenses and buy clothes.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, 60, is widowed and resides with her daughter in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fruit vendor. Her daughter runs a cosmetics shop at home.

Phat requests a loan of 700 U.S. dollars (USD) to pay for her daughter’s examination in teacher training. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her daughter’s study in teacher training until she becomes a teacher.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's examination in teacher training.

loans.name: Brazio

texts.en: Brazio is a 28-year-old hardworking man living in Kyenjojo Uganda. He is a school proprietor and has been in service for 6 years. He started with a nursery school and has over time set up other levels. He has a challenge of limited funds to upgrade the school. His dream is to have a fully operational primary school. Brazio needs the loan facility to renovate the classroom structures.

loans.use: To renovate the classroom structures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more retail stock, such as sugar, salt, and flour.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita, 62, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is a widow and the mother of four children, one of whom is already married. She, together with her children, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Carmelita operates a retail store where she sells dishwashing products. What she basically does is buy dishwashing products from wholesalers, and then sell them piecemeal for a profit. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy dishwashing products to increase her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Carmelita hopes to be able to expand soon, and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of dishwashing products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adau

texts.en:
Adau is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of a food stall in Bor South Sudan for 3 years.

Adau is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar and milk. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and milk for sale.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 48-year-old married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been selling beans and maize for the last 6 years. He has a challenge of poor transportation facilities to move among the different markets.

His family dream is to build a permanent house. His business dream is to buy a motorcycle so as to ease movement from one market to another, plus to expand his produce store. Micheal needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Bahombeho Group

texts.fr:
Jean Joram  fait partie du groupe Bahombeho. Il a 36 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 2 mois à 4 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Joram  est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Joram  voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Joram is a member of the group Bahombeho. He is 36 years old, and he is married with three children ranging in age from 2 months to 4 years old. He attended 6 years of primary school.

Jean Joram is rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his credit to buy fertilizers. His business growth strategy is to be selective in the rice seed that he sows. 

In the coming years, Jean Joram would like to become the local rice supplier. He plans to use his profits to provide for his children’s education and tuition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock clothings for her clothing business

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en: Knarik is a young entrepreneur from Yerevan. She buys flowers, designs bouquets, and sells them. To meet the rising demand, Knarik needs to purchase more flowers. With the loan's help Knarik will expand her business and get more income. This will allow her to to increase the variety of her services and develop the business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for flowers

loans.name: Thecla

texts.en: Thecla is a 33-year-old single mother of a child living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and she also operates a retail shop. Her challenge is the low pay at school and her family dream is to build a permanent house and educate her child. She dreams of setting up a wholesale shop to boost her income. Thecla needs the loan facility to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy soap and sugar for her retail shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 50, is married with four children. Two of the children attend school and the other two have graduated from school. Maria lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Maria operates a maize selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of maize in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 54 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adelina has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from tricycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sidiki

texts.fr:
Monsieur SIDIKI est âgé de 46 ans et est père de 7 enfants. Il vit dans une traditionnelle dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Du a des problèmes de famille, il a prématurément abandonné l’école pour s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il s’est basé sur  la vente des poissons fumés qu’il apprit auprès de son père il y a 20 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne, car les poissons fumés sont les plus prisés à Koutiala.  
Pour pouvoir  augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il a décidé de rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, est à son deuxième  prêt individuel dont le premier a été bien remboursé . 
Avec ce financement, il compte acheter,  10 paniers de poissons fumés  à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs d’ethnie  Bozo  et  Somonô. Monsieur SIDIKI  effectue sa vente au  marché de poisson de Koutiala  à une clientèle constituée  de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant  et à crédit. 
Avec ce financement il compte  réaliser un profit de 120.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Sidiki is 46 years old and the father of seven children. He lives in a traditional family in the city of Koutiala.

Due to family problems, he left school early and from an early childhood took an interest in income-generating activities. After trying his hand at several activities without success, he focused on the sale of smoked fish, which he learned from his father 20 years ago.

His reputation is good, because smoked fish are quite popular in Koutiala.

To increase his working capital and strengthen his sales, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. He is on his second individual loan, the first having been fully repaid.

With this funding, he intends to buy 10 baskets of smoked fish in Korientzé (in the Mopti Region), from fishermen belonging to the Bozo and Somonô ethnic groups. Mr. Sidiki retails his products at the Koutiala fish market, to both men and women customers, for cash or credit.

He expects this funding will enable him to attain monthly profits of 120,000 FCFA he will use to repay interest on the Soro Yiriwaso loan, meet his family's needs, and invest the rest in his business activity.

loans.use: Buy smoked fish

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cristina has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. Loreta is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Loreta requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. Loreta has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for five years.

In order to supplement her meager salary, she decided to set up a canteen. Her family dream is to build a permanent house to live in, and her business dream is to increase her stock. Sarah needs the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell in the school canteen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more retail goods such as maize flour, salt, beans, rice, curry powder, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en:
Maritta is 37 years old and is married with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past six years, Maritta has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Maritta is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials and to repair her fishing boat. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past seven years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Rosalie is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 34 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for her children. For the past 11 years, Emily has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells items such as sugar, soap, and other grocery items. 

Emily is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Dufatanye /shr Group

texts.fr:
Marc  fait partie du groupe Dufatanye/Shyr. Il a 55 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 13 à 34 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Marc est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Marc voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marc is a member of the group Dufatanye/Shyr. He is 55 years old and married with eight children ranging in age from 13 to 34, two of whom are at school. Marc attended 5 years of primary school.

Marc is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he will use the loan to buy fertilizers.

His business growth strategy is to be selective in the rice seed that he sows. In the coming years, Marc would like to expand his farmable area. He will use his profits to support his children’s education and tuition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 56 years old and married with three children.

Fatima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a wholesale retail of dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dry goods to sell.

Fatima has borrowed and paid for eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the wholesale retail of dry goods for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Fatima aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Maria Elena requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Maria Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Garnet

texts.en:
Garnet is 44 years old and married with 2 children.

Garnet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products for her sari sari store.

Garnet has borrowed and paid for 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and entertainment (videoke).

Garnet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more products for her sari sari store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a dried-fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by buying and selling salt. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her dried-fish-vending business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 62 years old and married with eight children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Consolacion has borrowed and paid for five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from computer games.

Consolacion aspires to to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 46 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for four years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, and school supplies. 

In the future Elvie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Johaira

texts.en:
Johaira is 23 years of age and single business woman. She needs to work hard to provide for her family.

Johaira sells shoes, slippers and sandals to the public market of Santiago City.  She has been in this business for almost 6 years.  Though she is single, she proves that she could improve her vending activity.  She would like to increase her profit by increasing the quantities of slippers,shoes and sandals she sells within the market. She hopes that she could obtain her goal in life, which is to become a successful businesswoman someday.

Johaira is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy additional quantities of slippers, shoes and sandals to sell. She hopes that this loan will be granted to her as it is the only opportunity to progress her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy slippers,shoes and sandals for her retail business

loans.name: Vithel

texts.en:
Vithel is 39 years old and married with two children currently going to school. Vithel works very hard to provide for them.

Vithel runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.  

Vithel has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, bread, canned goods, spices, etc.. 

In the future Vithel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Montana

texts.en:
Montana is 54 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Montana runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Montana has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years, and she earns additional income from fishing, farming rice, and food vending. Montana aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 53 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Nelita has run a general store in the Philippines for 12 years. She sells a variety of items such as biscuits, eggs, bread, milk, and sugar. She has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

In the future, Nelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a married woman who works hard to support her family. She has been buying and selling mangoes in the Philippines for 24 years. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of mangoes to sell.

In the future, Marietta would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Marzouka

texts.en:
Marzouka is an unmarried 28-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents and five siblings, two of whom are still in school while the other three work. Marzouka is doing the best she can to offer a good life to her family. She started her own farming business in 2008, and she has eight years of work experience in agriculture. She cultivates fresh, natural vegetables.

Marzouka wants to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. She believes that her harvest will be as good as the care she gives to her land. In the future, she plans to open her own vegetable shop.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zoure Group

texts.fr:
Mme KISWENDSIDA RACHEL  est la représentante du groupe ZOURE. Elle est  divorcée  et mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé  a 21ans et  le moins âgé a 04ans. 05 vont  à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend divers marchandises (arachides, galettes, bonbon et haricots) depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  marché de Napougo en ville. Ses clients sont  les femmes et hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  05 plats d’haricots, 05 plats de petit mil, 01kg de sucre et 01 litre d’huile.

 Mme épargne  ses bénéfices pour ajouter d’autres produits. Elle ambitionne  aider ses enfants à aller loin dans leur étude à travers la scolarité.
texts.en:
Kiswindsida Rachel is the representative of the group Zoure. She is divorced and the mother of six children. The oldest is 21 years old and the youngest is four. Five of the children are in school. Kiswindsida Rachel supports another three people.

She has been selling various food goods (groundnuts, pancakes, sweets and beans) for five years. She buys her supplies at the Napougo market in town. Her customers are men and women.

She wants to buy 5 bowls of beans, 5 bowls of pearl millet, 1 kg of sugar and 1 litre of oil.

Kiswindsida Rachel saves her profits to buy other products. Her ambition is to help her children succeed in their studies through attending school.

loans.use: to buy 5 bowls of beans, 5 bowls of pearl millet, 1 kg of sugar and 1 litre of oil.

loans.name: Abiyemejumurimo/kmg Group

texts.fr:
Jacques  fait partie du groupe Abiyemejumurimo/Kmg. Il a 50 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 5 à 23 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de primaire.

Jacques est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jacques voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jacques is a member of the Abiyemejumurimo/Kmg group. He is 50 years old and married with 7 children aged between 5 and 23. Six of the children are in school. He supports one other person. Jacques completed 4 years of primary education.

Jacques is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizers.

His strategy for business growth is to use selected rice seed. In the next few years, Jacques would like to expand the surface area of his rice farm. With the profits, he is planning to educate his children by sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 40 year old a married woman with four children.  Three of them are in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Achol requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas, 33, is a single mother of one child who attends school. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Rent is their greatest monthly expense.

Dorcas operates a green grocery business at the market, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. Dorcas dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 30,000, Dorcas wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions to sell. She joined Yehu to access financial services.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal, 48, has been farming for close to 20 years. He plies his trade in Mpigi. The widower and father of eight grows and sells cash crops, such as coffee, sugarcane, maize, and bananas. He supplements his income by raising pigs.

What explains his longevity in this business? Pascal says it’s through purposefulness and hard work that he has managed to keep his business afloat. In addition, the crops he grows sell well, which helps to explain his long tenure in the business. Though he has made great progress, Pascal is still hell-bent on greater success. His determination will come in handy. In the near future, he hopes to expand his pig husbandry business

Pascal intends to use his Kiva loan to purchase high-grade manure to apply to his crops.

loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure for his farm.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 36-year-old married man with four children, and he lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been a carpenter for 16 years, and he inherited his shop from his father. His challenges include customers who fail to pay on time, and his dream is to expand his business into new markets. Charles is requesting a loan to buy a welding machine for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, 48, is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cafe that serves her neighbors and passersby. Rehema dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 15,000 she wants to purchase food stocks, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food stocks, wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has run a clinic in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Achol is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase drugs and gloves. She will use her extra income to build a very big house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase drugs and gloves to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 48 years old.  She is married with seven children, two of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a kiosk business from her home, selling household consumptions like maize flour and wheat flour to her neighbors and passersby.  The major challenge Beatrice faces in her retail business is the high cost of transportation.  She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for sale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access capital and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beds and drugs for the clinic.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is 28 years old.  He is married with five children and owns a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda where he lives.  Ronald is responsible for looking after his family and he desires to educate his children.  He grows tea and has been farming for five years.  His main challenge is the high cost of production and his dream is to venture into mechanized farming.  Ronald is requesting this loan in order to plant more tea.

loans.use: to plant more tea.

loans.name: Abaul

texts.en:
Abaul is 28 years old.  She is married and does not have any children. For the past three years, Abaul has run a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan.  

Abaul is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru:
Зарине 26 лет, замужем и воспитывает двоих детей.
Зарина родилась в селе Панфиловское, в простой семье фермера с 5-ю детьми. С детства она помогала матери по уходу за домом и младшими детьми. В 2002 году Зарина поступила в Архитектурный университет, где проучилась 5 лет и в 2007 году Зарина вернулась в родное село к своим родителям.
В 2008 году в возрасте 23 лет, Зарина вышла замуж. Год спустя, в 2009 году у них родилась первая дочь, а через год еще одна. 
В поиске источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2010 году Зарина с мужем решают приобрести торговый павильон в поселке Каинда. Вложив начальный капитал, молодая семья выкупила торговое место и закупила первую партию товара.  
В данное время, благодаря  трудолюбию и упорству Зарины, ее магазин приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарина обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы она планирует вложить в пополнение товарных запасов и обновление торгового оборудования.
texts.en: Zarina is 26 years old, married and is raising two children.  She was born in the Panfilovskoye village, in a simple family of a farmer with five children.  Since childhood, she has been helping her mother with taking care of the house and the younger children.  Zarina was accepted into the Architectural University in 2002, where she studied for five years, and in 2007, Zarina returned to her parents in her native village.  In 2008, Zarina got married at the age of 23.  Her first daughter was born a year after that, in 2009, and then another daughter one year later.  In search of a source of income for her family, Zarina and her husband decided to purchase a retail space in the Kainda village in 2010.  Having invested an initial capital, the young family bought out the retail space and purchased a new inventory of merchandise.  At the present time, thanks to Zarina's love of hard work and persistence, her store yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Zarina requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand the assortment of merchandise.  She plans to invest the profits into refilling her merchandise inventories and updating her retail equipment.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure to use on his farms.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 59 years old,  married, and has six children, two of whom attend school. For the past six months, Ali has operated a retail shop, selling household staples to his neighbors and passersby. He also farms to earn additional income. 

Ali is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

Ali lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. He dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Akal

texts.en:
Akal is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. All of them are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Akal is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.ru: С помощью предыдущего кредита Юлия значительно увеличила ассортимент товара. В этот раз Юлия берет кредит на закупку семян для продажи. Недавно она начала строительство своего киоска на рынке.  В семье все хорошо. Муж работает на Тепловой электростанции в Энергодаре. Дочь учится в Мелитопольской академии на 3-м курсе.
texts.en: With the help of the previous loan Yuliya has greatly increased the assortment of goods. This time, Yuliya is taking a loan for the purchase of seeds for sale. She recently started construction of its stall in the market. Her family is well. Her husband works at the thermal power plant in Energodar. Her daughter is a third year student of the Melitopol Academy.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 21 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda.  For the past six years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her small business, which makes and sells cassava flour. 

Ruth is requesting a loan for 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more cassava for resale. This loan will help Ruth  generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a school. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Ruth's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more cassava for resale.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's group is comprised of seven hard working women. Jackline is 22-years-old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her clothes store which sells various kinds of clothing. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bundles of clothes and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jackline's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine 62, is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a maize selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to be a wholesale supplier of maize in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Ajah

texts.en:
Ajah is a 29-year-old married woman with no child. She has had a business of selling food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ajah is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar and oil for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, and oil for sale.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah 64, is a mother of one child who graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Monicah dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale to meet her customers' demands. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Maria Joey

texts.en:
Maria Joey is 38 years old and single. She is a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She manages her household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maria Joey operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials such as metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell to junk shops like Maria Joey's for a small profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

Maria Joey is requesting a loan for11, 000 PHP, which she will use to augment her current revolving fund to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Joey hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase scrap materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
С помощью предыдущего кредита Александр смог сделать отопление в теплице, а также усовершенствовал теплицу для рассады. Также Александр приобрел участок земли рядом с домом и начал строить там дополнительную теплицу. Теперь ему нужен кредит, чтобы закончить новую теплицу и сделать там отопление, а также приобрести новые семена
Александр очень предприимчивый. Он  взял в аренду несколько садов в соседнем селе; зимой обрезает ветки в садах и использует дрова для отопления теплиц.
texts.en: With the help of the previous loan, Alexander was able to build a heating system in his greenhouse and improved the greenhouse for seedlings. Alexander also bought a plot of land next to his house and began to build an additional greenhouse. Now he needs a loan to finish the new greenhouse and build a heating system, as well as purchase new seeds. Alexander is very enterprising. He rented a few gardens in the nearby village. In winter, he trims the branches in the gardens and uses firewood to heat his greenhouses.

loans.use: to build a heating system in his new greenhouse and buy seeds.

loans.name: Amuor

texts.en:
Amuor is 30 years old, married, and has four children. two of whom attend school. She has a hotel in Langber Bor, South Sudan which she has been  running for three years.

Amuor is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is 40 years old. He has been engaged in the farming business for 15 years. He lives with his wife and two children. He wants to further develop his business in order to continue to live a comfortable life. In order to do this he is asking for a loan in the amount of P25,000 to purchase corn seed, fertilizer and pesticide for use in his business. Hopefully, with the help of this material he can improve his farm and yield more fruitful crops. He also continues to send his children to school so that they can achieve their preferred careers.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer and pesticide for use in his business

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica 70, a married woman with six children, all of whom are over 30 years of age, owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her grand children who she is supporting.

Dorica sells farm produce such as sugar cane and maize from her farm. She sells as wholesale, at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Dorica faces the major challenges of price fluctuation and climatic changes. She dreams of expanding her business and hiring more people in the future. Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, with the Kshs 50,000 loan she wants to pay for the transport and employment of workers doing the harvest.

loans.use: to pay for the transport and employment of workers during the harvest.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 53, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a vendor, and is the mother of seven children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Lolita operates a market stall. She sells vegetable, raw products and condiments in the community market. She buys large quantities of vegetables and other common items used in cooking and sells them by the kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue running her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more vegetable products and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lolita dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business and to build her house in her province. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of vegetables and other products for her business

loans.name: Kiwambi Mshangano Myangayanga Group

texts.en:
Sabina is a 38 year old married woman with five children, one of whom attends secondary school. She has been growing maize, coffee and beans in her 12 acre plot for over three years. She faces farming problems such as a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Sabina is seeking more working capital to finance her farming activities by buying fertilizers and insecticides. In the next five years she hopes to build a better house and to be able to pay for school fees, after improving her farming operation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Korotimi

texts.fr:
Mme KOROTIMI est  mariée  et mère d’un  enfant. Il a 04ans et  ne va  à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes  en charge (son enfant plus 02 frères dont un va à l’école).

Elle est restauratrice  depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de gounghin. Ses clients sont  les  hommes, les femmes et enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  05 casseroles et 07 chaises pour son restaurant.

 Mme épargne  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne  agrandir son restaurant et payer la scolarité de ses frères dont il a la charge.
texts.en:
Mrs. Korotimi is married and the mother of one child.  He is four years old and does not go to school.  She is responsible for three people (her child and two brothers, one of whom is in school).

Mrs. Korotimi has had a restaurant for a year.  She buys her supplies at the Gounghin market.  Her customers are men, women, and children.  She would like to buy five cooking pots and seven chairs for her restaurant.

Mrs. Korotimi saves her profits, and hopes to enlarge her restaurant and pay school fees for her brothers who are in her care.

loans.use: to buy five cooking pots and seven chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Dukundumurimo Twitezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Marini  fait partie du groupe Dukundumurimo Twitezimbere. Il a 52 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 2 à 12 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Il a 3 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Marini est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Marini voudrait être le premier fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Marini is a member of the Dukundumurimo Twitezimbere group.  He is 52 years old, married, and has four children ranging from 2  to 12 years old. Two of his children attend school.  Besides his children, he also financially supports three additional persons.  He completed five years of primary education.  Marini is a rice farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will be using his loan to buy chemical fertilizers.  In order to develop his business, Marini's strategy is to use selected rice seedlings.  In the coming years, he would like to be the main supplier of rice in his region.  He plans to use the profits to educate his children and send them to school.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old married woman with four children. Two of them are in school. For two years, she has had a business selling food from her stall in Bor, South Sudan. 

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil to sell.

loans.name: Hagurukamuhinzi/cyrkr Group

texts.fr:
Jean Baptiste  fait partie du groupe Hagurukamuhinzi/Cyrkr. Il a 33 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 2 à 12 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Baptiste est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Baptiste voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean Baptiste belongs to the Hagurukamuhinzi/Cyrkr group.  He is 33 years old and is married with four children ranging from two to 12 years old.  Two are in school.  He has six years of elementary education. Jean Baptiste grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer. His strategy to grow his business is to use selected rice seedlings.  In the coming years, Jean Baptiste would like to be the rice supplier in his region.  With the profits, he plans to raise his children and provide schooling for them.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 54, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Her husband is Fernando, a technician, and she is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business.

Teresita operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, "cartolina" and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. She also operates a Xerox machine for copying services.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are students and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her Xerox machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for stock of school supplies and maintenance of her Xerox machine.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Catherine has a restaurant at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy rice, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes and flour. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business so as to serve more customers. 

Catherine lives in a  rented house and the  family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rice, flour, Irish potatoes  and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Madjelia

texts.fr:
Mme MADJELIA est  mariée  et n’a pas enfant. Personne ne  va  à l’école. Elle a 01 personne  en charge.

Elle vend  des pagnes depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au Mali et Bobo. Ses clients sont  les voisins, les amis et les agents des différents services.

Elle veut  s’acheter  08 pagnes dont l’unité coûte 17500frcs.

 Mme utilise  ses bénéfices pour améliorer son activité. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir un magasin de pagnes.
texts.en: Mrs MADJELIA is married without children. No-one goes to school. She has 01 dependent. She has been selling 'pagnes' (traditional cloths) for 02 years. She gets her supplies in Mali and Bobo. Her customers are friends, neighbours and workers from various entities. She wishes to purchase 08 pagnes, each of which costs 17500frcs. She uses her profits to improve her business. She hopes to open a shop selling pagnes.

loans.use: to purchase 08 traditional cloths 'pagnes', each of which costs 17500frcs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stoves, glasses, plates, cutlery, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Buud Nooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme FELICITE est la représentante du groupe BUUD NOOMA. Elle est  mariée  et mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé  a 05ans et  le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va  à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes  et prêt à porte depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont  les femmes.

Elle veut  s’acheter 10 complets pagnes et 15 prêts à porté pour enfants.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour  contribuer aux  dépenses de la famille. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en: Mrs FELICITE is the representative of the BUUD NOOMA group. She is married and the mother of 02 children. The elder is 5, and the younger 2 years old. One goes to school. She has 03 dependents. She has been selling traditional cloth and ready to wear clothing for 06 years. She buys her stock in the market in sector 10. Her customers are women. She wants to purchase 10 traditional cloth suits and 15 ready to wear outfits for children. She uses her profits to contribute to the family's living expenses. She hopes to open a large store.

loans.use: to buy 10 traditional cloth suits and 15 ready to wear outfits for children

loans.name: Alie A.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in a village close to Makeni City, in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, for a loan of 20,300,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. 

At the end of each month, they use their monthly salaries to repay the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayment on their behalf.

Alie (who is pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of teachers. Born fifty-eight years ago in the village of Masongbo, this husband and father of ten children has served in the teaching profession for thirty-eight years now. His wife is a teacher, too, and his children are attending primary, secondary, and tertiary institutions. 

Alie has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.name: Karachach

texts.ru:
Карачач 43 года, замужем, имеет четверых  сыновей и одну дочь. Муж работает в средней школе села Спартак заведующим хозяйства. Карачач выросла в семье фермеров, ее родители издавна занимались животноводством. Имея большой опыт в ведении хозяйства, 20 лет назад семья Карачач начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Администрация села Спартак  выделила в аренду земельную долю, где они  выращивают кукурузу, сахарную свеклу и зерновые культуры. В настоящее время  в хозяйстве Карачач имеется  4 головы дойных коров, 15 голов овец, приносящие доход от сдачи молока производителям молочной продукции в сумме около 15,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях расширения бизнеса, Карачач обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы, семян хорошего сорта пшеницы и минеральных удобрений для весеннего посева. В планах у Карачач – купить машину для своей семьи, так как место проживания семьи находится в 35 км от  районного центра.
texts.en:
Karachach is 43 years old, married and has four sons and one daughter. Her husband works at a high school in the village Spartak, managing the economy. 

Karachach grew up in a family of farmers and her parents were for a long time engaged in animal husbandry. Having extensive experience with farm management, Karachach's family started working with livestock and field-crop cultivation 20 years ago. The administration of the village Spartak provided for rent of land, where they grow sweet corn, sugar-beet and cereals. Currently, at the farm, Karachach has four dairy cows and 15 sheep, and the income from selling milk to producers of dairy products is in total around 15,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to expand her business, Karachach turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of milking cows, wheat seeds of good quality and fertilizer for spring planting. Karachach has plans to buy a car for her family, as the family home is located 35 km from the district center.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en: Pavel is married and has two sons and a daughter. His family of five lives in Vodyanoye. Pavel owns a greenhouse where he grows tomatoes, radishes, parsley, etc. He’s had it for 10 years. Pavel wants to remodel his greenhouse for the upcoming farming season.  He has about 30,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. He spends 10,000 to 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year. Pavel is requesting a 20,000 Grivnya loan to construct a bigger and more durable greenhouse to ensure better and richer harvests and additional income as a result.

loans.use: construct a new greenhouse

loans.name: Abèle

texts.fr: Abèle vit avec son mari et a deux  enfants. Elle est commerçante et a pour activité la vente des tenues tout-cousus, des divers, pacotilles, et produits de beauté dans son quartier. Elle s'approvisionnait à dans un marché hors du bénin et a constaté au fils des temps que les mêmes articles sont vendus dans les marchés de cotonou et au même coût. Elle a dû commencer par faire ses achats sur Cotonou et s'y rend au moins une fois par semaine. Soucieuse de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle souhaite le renouvellement de son micro crédit à Finadev visant à maximiser ses intérêts, renforcer son fonds de commerce et à scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Abèle lives with her husband and has two children. She is a vendor  selling ready-to-wear clothing, miscellaneous items, fashion jewelry and cosmetic products in her distric.t She used to stock up at a market outside of Benin. As time passed, she started seeing the same items being sold at the markets of Cotonou at the same cost. She  had to start making her purchases in Cotonou, traveling there at least once a week. With the goal of meeting customer demand, she would like to take out a new microloan from Finadev in order to maximize her profits, bolster her working capital and provide for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy various body creams, gels and beauty  products for women

loans.name: Karanpil

texts.en:
Karanpil is 66 years old.  She lives in the village of Kesali in East Georgia. Karanpil is married and lives with her family: husband – Takhmaz, their 46-year-old son, their daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (17 and 16 years old).  The children go to school. 

All adult family members are involved in the family's agricultural activities, which is the only source of income for them. They have a small dairy farm. Karanpil produces cheese and sells it in Gardabani (a nearby town).  The family also owns a plot of land where various vegetables are grown. The family sells vegetables locally to the green grocery retailers.  The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris. 

Karanpil requested credit to purchase 2 additional milk cows.  This will increase their production and sales of cheese, which will increase the income for the family and allow them to purchase needed household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Sharon Fe

texts.en:
Sharon Fe is a married woman with one child. She is 40 years old and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Sharon Fe owns and operates a business venture, planting & harvesting decorative plants for sale to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of business. 

Sharon Fe requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.  In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: buy seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Moussiratou

texts.fr: Dame Aba est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de divers, de riz, d'huiles et de l'eau glacée à domicile. Très connue dans son quartier, elle s'approvisionne au marché environnantes. La cliente sollicite le concours de Finadev pour l'obtention d'un prêt afin de pouvoir faire face aux charges  personnelles et familiales.
texts.en: Mrs. Aba is married and the mother of five. She specializes in selling miscellaneous items, rice, vegetable oil and iced water out of her house. Very well known in her neighborhood, she stocks up at nearby markets. This client is seeking the support of Finadev to obtain a loan which would allow her to cover personal and family expenses.

loans.use: to buy  25 big bottles of mayonnaise, 100 1-kg bags of rice, 100 1-liter bottles of oil, etc

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with three children. She is 56 years old and resides in Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lilia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. 

Lilia requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more products to resell.  She has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to make an expansion to her business.

loans.use: buy more products to resell

loans.name: Aba Ami

texts.fr: Dame Aba est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de divers, de riz, d'huiles et de l'eau glacée à domicile. Très connue dans son quartier, elle s'approvisionne dans les machés de la ville. La cliente sollicite le concours de Finadev pour l'obtention d'un prêt afin de pouvoir faire face aux charges  personnelles et familiales.
texts.en: Aba is married and the mother of five children.  She sells various grocery products such as rice, oil, and frozen water from her home.  Aba is well-known in her neighborhood.  She buys her products at various markets in town.  Aba is requesting a loan from Finadev in order to meet personal and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy 25 large jars of Mayonnaise, 100 bags containing 1kg. of rice, 100 bottles of oil and other grocery products.

loans.name: Wiliva

texts.en:
Wiliva is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Wiliva is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Wiliva owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Wiliva is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of her motorcycle.

In 2010, Wiliva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to maintain and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
В прошлом году Андрей брал кредит на постройку дополнительной теплицы. Увеличился доход, приобрел автомобиль Фиат, не новый, но в очень хорошем состоянии.
Сейчас Андрею нужны дополнительные средства на отопление, закупку семян и пленки.
Интересно отметить, что в этом году жена Андрея ушла с наемной работы и тоже начала свой бизнес. Она ездит  по селам и торгует фруктами и цитрусовыми. Теперь у Андрея с женой два бизнеса.
texts.en: Last year, Andrei took a loan for the construction of an additional greenhouse. His profit increased and he bought a Fiat, not new but in very good condition. Now Andrei needs additional funds to install heating in the greenhouse and purchase seeds and greenhouse film. It is also interesting to note that this year Andrei's wife started her own business. She travels from village to village and sells fruits and citrus. Now Andrei and his wife have two businesses.

loans.use: to install heating in his greenhouse and purchase seeds and greenhouse film

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de maïs, haricot , gari et huiles dans une baraque . Elle détient également en portefeuile un centre d'élevage de volaille qui fait la provenderie. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la ville.  Dans le but de renforcer ses activités, dame Christine cliente sollicite le concours de Finadev pour l'obtention d'un prêt afin de pouvoir faire face aux charges personnelles et familiales.
texts.en: Christine is married and the mother of six children.  She sells maize, beans, gari (flour made from cassava) and oil from a food booth.  Her portfolio also includes a poultry farm that produces livestock feed.  She buys her products at various markets in town.  In order to bolster her business activity, Christine is requesting a loan from Finadev.  This loan will allow her to cover personal and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy five bags of maize, two bags of flour, one bag of beans and other food products.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and single. 

To make a living, Ivy owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ivy has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ivy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivy  is requesting a loan of  20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en:
Gurban lives in the village of Azizkendi in East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Piala, 13-year-old son and 11-year-old daughter. The children go to school. 

Gurban is leading the agricultural business for his family, which is the main source of the income for the family. The family has 2 milk cows and 3 calves.   Gurban  produces cheese and sells it in the village to dairy products retailers.  The family also has a greenhouse where cucumbers and tomatoes are grown.  The harvested vegetables are sold locally to the retailers as well.  The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris. 

Gurban requested credit to purchase an additional milk cow. The family will have 50% more milk for cheese production from this purchase. They will increase the sale of cheese and thus get more income, which will allow them to increase their spending and improve their family living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
