Rene is married and has 5 children.  He is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rene operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living.  He has been doing this for 3 years and every month he earns PHP 3,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Rene has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, he hopes to finish the study of his children and to gain double income out from his business.

loans.use: repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy used bags to resell

loans.name: Foulératou

texts.fr: Foulératou est mariée avec un enfant à charge. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des articles de mercerie, divers, produits cosmétiques et boissons dans sa boutique .Elle s'approvisionne  à dans les marchés du bénin et hors du bénin. Pour agrandir son atelier et renforcer la revente, elle sollicite un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Elle utilisera le revevu complémentaire pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et le reste pour ses propres besoins.
texts.en: Foulératou is married and financially supports one child.  She sells small articles for sewing, and other products such as cosmetics and drinks, from a shop.  She buys her products at various markets in Bénin  and outside of Bénin.  In order to increase the size of her shop and to bolster her sales, she is requesting a loan from Finadev.  She will use the additional revenues to boost her business and the rest to meet personal needs.

loans.use: To buy several spools of thread, zips, needles, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Aracelle

texts.en:
Aracelle is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Aracelle is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Aracelle runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps, and many other things. Aracelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Aracelle is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Aracelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Houenoussou2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement HOUENOUSSOU2 est composé de onze personnes qui habitent la même agglomération et mènent des activités complémentaires. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yèyinou Hortance est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yèyinou Hortance est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Jeames. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Yèyinou Hortance mène comme activité depuis dix ans la vente de tissus, de chaussures et d’ignames de façon ambulante dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Yèyinou Hortance s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Yèyinou Hortance sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUENOUSSOU2, un deuxième crédit. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
HOUENOUSSOU2 Group is made up of eleven persons who live in the same town and run complementary businesses. This is the second time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Yèyinou Hortance, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 32 years old and married to a mechanic named Jeames. 

They have five school-attending children to support, and they take care of the various household expenses.

For ten years, Yèyinou Hortance has been selling fabrics, shoes, and yams as a traveling saleswoman in one of Benin's market. This business enables her to provide for herself and her children.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's market. Eager to satisfy her clientele and in order to increase her revenue and income, Yèyinou Hortance is seeking a second loan, together with the other members of the group. The first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy shoes, fabrics, and sacks of yams

loans.name: Sonia

texts.fr: Sonia est mariée avec un enfant . Elle est commerçante et a pour activité la vente des tenues tout-cousus, chaussures, sacs et fournitures scolaires dans sa boutique. Elle s'approvisionne preque toutes les semaines. Dans le but de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle souhaite bénéficier d'un renouvellement de son micro crédit à Finadev visant à maximiser ses intérêts et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire .
texts.en:
Sonia is married and has one child. She sells ready-to-wear clothing, shoes, handbags and school supplies in her store.

She gets new supplies almost every week. Eager to satisfy the needs of her clientele, she would like to obtain a new loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev, in order to maximize her revenue.

loans.use: to buy 20 packs of 200 pagnes (colorful African cloth), 30 packs of 100 paper sheets, and 3 packs of ballpoint pens ("Bic" and other brands)

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Patience has been working hard to manage her market stand, which sells fresh fruit. 

To help expand her business, Patience has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes and other fruits, and will help Patience to generate greater profits and pay her family's bills. Patience hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Patience is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Patience's future prospects by helping her.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and other fruits

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old Lebanese man who is married and living with his wife. Since 2005 he has had his own business as a painter and takes on house projects in order to better his way of life.

Today, he’s asking to borrow 800 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional painting supplies. This Kiva loan will improve his work and allow him to take on new and bigger projects, thus earning him a better income.

In the future, he plans to open his own painter’s shop and take on more and similar projects.

loans.use: to purchase additional painting supplies.

loans.name: Tukazban

texts.en:
Tukazban is a 62-year-old farmer from the village of Birliki. She is married and lives with her husband and 29-year-old daughter-in-law.

Tukazban and her husband have a milk cow and two calves. The family sells milk in the village. They also have a plot of land where they grow greens. Tukazban sells their harvested greens in Tbilisi, Georgia’s capital. The family’s total average monthly income is 450 GEL.

Tukazban has requested a loan to purchase two calves. She will feed them for four months, then sell them at a higher price. This will bring in additional income for the family, which will be used to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie, 29, is a married woman with two children. She lives in Clarin in Misamis Occidental province in the Philippines.

Jovie plants, harvests and sells fruit to earn a living. She has done so for the past ten years and now earns 5,000 PHP a month.

Jovie has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise. In the future, Jovie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Agbodohoin

texts.fr:
Agboédohoin est une femme  âgé(e) de 56ans. Elle est mère de 06 enfants. Quatre vont à l’école. L’ainé a 17ans et le dernier 07ans.
Agboédohoin travaille comme revendeuse de maïs, de SODABI et autres depuis 1979. Elle vend seule à toute personne à la maison et achète les marchandises à Lomé.
Agboédohoin a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du SODABI, du Mais et autres. Elle veut avoir une boutique.
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Agboédohoin is a 56 year old lady. She is the mother of 6 children, 4 of whom attend school. The eldest is 17 and the youngest 7 years old. Agboédohoin is a reseller of corn, of sodabi (West African palm wine liqueur used in local ceremonies) and other items since 1979. She sells independently from home to all her customers, and she buys her goods in Lomé. Agboédohoin requires her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase sodabi, corn and other goods. She hopes to have a shop. She states that with her profits, she intends to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sodabi (local wine liqueur) and corn

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and all go to school. Patience has no additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes door-to-door. She has been in this business for 2 years. She works seven days a week.  Patience has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to start importing used clothes and also to build her own house. 

Patience lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Mahuclo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHUCLO est composé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Jeanne Léocadie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne Léocadie est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne Léocadie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Jeanne Léocadie est mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Elias. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Jeanne Léocadie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jeanne Léocadie exerce depuis quatre ans la couture à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Jeanne Léocadie vend des céréales, des chaussures et des tissus. Jeanne Léocadie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jeanne Léocadie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement MAHUCLO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Mahuclo group consists of thirteen persons from the same neighborhood. This is the second time the group has sought financial support from ALIDé, to raise the level of its business activities.

The representative of the group, Jeanne Léocadie, is raisiing her hand in the picture. She is 39 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at primary level.

Jeanne Léocadie is married to an entrepreneur named Elias. The couple has three children; all attend school and are their dependents. In addition to their own children, the couple takes care of another child. Jeanne Léocadie lives together with her ​​husband and children.

To deal with various family expenses over the past four years, Jeanne Léocadie has been working at home as a seamstress. As a second activity, she sells grain cereals, shoes and fabrics. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin and also from Togo.

Seeking to satisfy customers and wanting to increase her turnover and income, Jeanne Léocadie, together with the other members of the Mahuclo group, is requesting a second credit loan from ALIDé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy haberdashery items, bags and shoes

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, 33, is a married woman with three children. She lives in Tinacla-an, a neighborhood of Clarin in the province of Misamis Occidental.

For the past ten years Lourdes has planted, harvested and sold bananas to earn a living. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP from doing so.

Lourdes has been a member of GDMPC for almost four years. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise.

In the future, Lourdes wants to make improvements on her house and put her children through school.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fresh cassava and butter nose fish.

loans.name: Akuach

texts.en:
Akuach is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. All of her children are in school. She has had a business selling milk in Langber Bor, South Sudan for 2 years.

Akuach is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and milk. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and milk for sale.

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Agnès vit maritalement avec trois enfants. Entre temps, elle vendait seulement les pagnes mais compte tenu du non remboursement des créances elle a complèté avec la restauration plus précisement la vente de viande de porc. Vue la situation géographique de son fonds, L'activité lui marche bien et elle sollicite le concours de Finadev afin de diversifier son activité et de fidéliser sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Agnes lives with a companion and three children. For some time she sold only pagnes (a colorful West-African fabric), but due to defaulting customers she had to supplement her income by selling food preparations, in particular pork meat.

Business is doing well given the location of her activity, so she is requesting the assistance of Finadev to diversify her business activities and develop customer loyalty.

loans.use: Buy pagnes, shoes and other items

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 25-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and three working siblings. Her father is satisfying their needs to be capable of living as they should be. In order to help him, she decided to start her own business. So she opened her clothing shop in 2009. She sells stylish, fashionable, and trendy clothes. 

Today, Zeinab is requesting a loan of $1600 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new collection of clothes, such as dresses, scarves, pants, and many other items. She notes that this loan will certainly push her to get higher returns. In the future, she plans to open other branches as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes such as dresses, scarves, pants, and many other items.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with three children. She is 33 years old and resides in Montol, Ozamiz City, Philippines. 

Zenaida owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Zenaida has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost 4 years. In the future, Zenaida hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman who has five children. Evangeline is 48 years old and resides at Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Evangeline owns and operate a business venture planting & harvesting bananas to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Evangeline has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en: Agnes is a 38-year-old businesswoman. She lives in her own house with her husband and child. She is very dedicated to her work. She owns and operates a small printing and typesetting shop. She supports her family with the earnings she makes from her business. She wants to use the loan to purchase an additional photocopy machine to expand her business. She hopes to save more towards her child’s education and to build an additional house. She belongs to the community group called King Jesus Trust Group. The group members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans on time.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A PHOTOCOPY MACHINE

loans.name: Honsiyata's Group

texts.en:
Honsiyata's group is comprised of four hard-working women. Honsiyata is 20 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Honsiyata has been working hard to manage her small business selling maize. 

To help expand her business, Honsiyata has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize for resale, and will help Honsiyata to generate greater profits and pay her family's medical expenses. Honsiyata hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Honsiyata is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Honsiyata's future prospects by helping her learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Alexandrine

texts.fr: Alexandrine vit en location avec son mari et à trois enfants. Elle a pour activité  principale la vente de charbons en sac et détail. Elle fait sa commande vers le Nord et est ravitaillée à Cotonou à son domicile. Soucieuse d'augmenter son stock, elle sollicite un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Elle utilisera le revenu complémentaire pour renforcer son fonds et le reste pour ses propres besoins ainsi que les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Alexandrine lives in a rental home with her ​​husband and three children. Her main activity is the retail selling of coal, in bags or retail.

She places her orders in the North and supplies are delivered at her home in Cotonou. Wanting to increase her stock, she is requesting a micro-credit loan from Finadev.

She will use the additional income to bolster her working capital, and use the rest for her own needs and those of her family.

loans.use: buy 96 bags of coal

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is married with two children. Glenn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Glenn is providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years and every month he earns 10,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to repair his vehicle for better service.

Glenn has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Glenn hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Nyandeng

texts.en: Nyandeng is 37 years old and married with three children. One of the children is in school. Nyandeng has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for 2 years. Nyandeng is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Jayjay

texts.en: Jayjay  is 39 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and has three children between 8 and 18, all of them are attending school and living with her sister.  For the past 18 years she has been selling  red oil (palm oil), pepper and rice in the local market.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper and rice for her business.  She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil), pepper and rice for her business

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Amavi est une femme  âgé(e) de 47 ans. Elle est mariée  å un employé au port avec 01 enfant âgé de 20ans.
Amavi travaille comme revendeuse d’huile et de tomate depuis 2001. Elle vend à ses clients à la maison après achat à Lomé. Elle travaille seule et n’a aucune difficulté.
Amavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de l’huile et de la tomate. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Amavi voudrait élargir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en:
Amavi is a 47-year-old woman. She is married to a port employee with one 20-year-old child.  She has been working as a reseller of oil and tomatoes since 2001.  She sells to her customers at home after purchasing her products in Lomé.  She works alone without any problems.

Amavi has requested her first loan through WAGES in order to buy oil and tomatoes.  She wants to reinvest in her business.  In the next few years, she would like to enlarge her business.  She says that with the profits she plans to care for her family.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil and cartons of tomatoes.

loans.name: Primetiva

texts.en:
Primetiva is married with 1 child. She is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Primetiva is a farmer and she also works in corn production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years.  Every month she earns 3,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Primetiva has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, Primetiva hopes to save a reserve fund for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel is a 35-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for five years.
Aluel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar, and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, and onions to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a married woman with two children. Juvy is 34 years old and she resides in Viray Molicay, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

To earn a living, Juvy plants and harvests bananas for sale.  Sh has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Juvy has been a member of GDMPC for almost two years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Nyandeng

texts.en:
Nyandeng is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Nyandeng is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Mila is married and has three school-aged children.

To make a living, Mila owns and operates a tricycle transport service. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab.) Mila has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mila is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of the motorcycle.

In 2006, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of the motorcycle

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr:
Cliente de 44 ans, célibataire avec 1 enfant, elle commence avec la vente de la friperie il y’a de cala plus de 20 ans, quand elle met au monde son premier enfant, étant fille mère pour se prendre en charge et subvenir aux besoins de son enfant.
Elle a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs prêts de Hope, ses prêts ont apporte un impact considérable dans sa vie sociale, ses ventes ont augmentes de 30.000 fr a 90.000frs, elle a rembourse sans difficultés et a fait des épargnes considérables.
Dans le souci d’être une grande femme d’affaire elle continue à épargner parce que dans l’avenir elle veut ouvrir un dépôt de friperie.
texts.en:
The client is 44 years old, single with a child. She began selling second-hand clothing some 20 years ago when she first gave birth. Unmarried, she had to support herself and meet her child's needs.

She has already been granted several loans from Hope, which made a considerable impact on her social life. Her sales increased from 30,000 to 90.000 francs, she reimbursed without a problem and made considerable savings.

With the intent of becoming a great businesswoman she continues to save, because in the future she wants to open a used clothing depot.

loans.use: buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 52-year-old married man and a father of four children.

Ali has raised cattle and sold their milk for the past 25 years.  He is an expert in his business and most meat dealers visit him because of the good quality they get.  Ali is a hard worker and a man with a very good reputation. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to prepare his business for the autumn/winter season. He wants to buy a large quantity of cattle food at special prices.  In addition to that, he wants to do necessary maintenance to the cattle's living space.  So, he needs to buy special iron shields to cover the space as much as he can.

Ali is a talented man in his domain, and he hopes to keep improving he business as much as he can by increasing the size of his herd of cattle.

loans.use: to buy necessary food for his cattle for the winter season.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a widow with six children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Leonarda is a farmer and she produces corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and every month she earn PHP 3,000 from this work. 

Leonarda has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Leonarda hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Awawou

texts.fr:
Awawou est une femme  âgé(e) de 41ans. Elle est mariée å un  militaire retraité. Elle est mére de 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 12ans et le dernier 06ans.
Awawou travaille comme revendeuse de bois de chauffage et du charbons de bois depuis 2000. Elle vend à la maison après achat à Lomé. Elle n’a pas de difficulté principale.
Awawou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de bois de chauffage, du charbon et des ignames. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, agrandir le commerce et assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Awawou is a 41-year-old woman.  She is married to a retired army member.  She is the mother of three children who all attend school.  Her oldest child is 12 years old and the youngest is 6.  Awawou has been reselling firewood and coal since 2000.  She buys her merchandise in Lomé and sells from home.  She experiences no major difficulty.  Awawou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy firewood, coal and yams.  She would like to reinvest in her professional activity, increase the size of her business and be able to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy firewood and coal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of tea and corn in bulk for resale at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alam

texts.en:
Alam is 30 years old and is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Alam is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба молодая женщина, замужем и  мать троих детей. До замужества отучилась на ювелира и сейчас занимается  тонким ювелирным делом. Мастерит женские  национальные украшения из золота необычных узоров. Свой готовый товар продает на рынке и в основном делает эти изделия на заказ. Имеет большой каталог образцов на любой вкус. Пока у неё нет своих учеников, так как у неё маленький ребёнок и на учеников почти нет свободного времени, но в будущем планирует открыть свою мастерскую и обучать девушек своему делу. Сотрудничает с нами с 2010г. И брала кредит на покупку лома для своих изделий. Сейчас уже кредитуется во второй раз  и очередной кредит использует на хозяйственные постройки. Так как муж Насибы сейчас на заработках за пределами города и у них началась стройка дома,Насибе необходим наш кредит.
texts.en: Nasiba is a young married woman and a mother of three children.  Prior to the marriage, she was studying to be a jewelry maker and is now involved in a fine jewelry business.  She makes women's national jewelry from gold with unusual designs.  Nasiba sells her goods at a market and primarily makes the jewelry to-order.  She has a large catalog of samples for every taste.  She does not yet have apprentices because she has a small child and would not have time for apprentices.  In the future, Nasiba plans to open her own shop and teach her trade to young women.  She has been partnering with us since 2010 and previously obtained a loan to purchase scrap to make her jewelry.  This is now her second time obtaining financing from us, and this is another loan to be used for household buildings.  Because Nasiba's husband is currently working outside the city limits, and their house construction has began, Nasiba needs our loan.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a married woman with one child. She is 20 years old and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

Claire owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Claire has been a member of GDMPC for nearly two years. In the future, Claire wants to make improvements to  her house and save reserves for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Tabyshbek

texts.ru:
Табышбеку 46 лет,  он отец пятерых детей. Табышбек сезонно работает в качестве строителя – отделочника, жена – домохозяйка. 16 лет назад, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Табышбек начал свой бизнес в полеводстве и разведении скота.  Начав со стартовой суммой в 50,000 сом (KGS), он взял в аренду земельный участок, где посеял картофель, фасоль и многолетние травы, а также развил хозяйство с дойными коровами.   
В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Табышбек обратился в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита он планирует направить на последующий закуп минеральных удобрений в целях повышения урожая.
texts.en:
Tabyshbek is 46 years old, he is a father of five children. Tabyshbek works seasonally as a builder-decorator and his wife is a homemaker. Sixteen years ago in search of an additional source of income for his family Tabyshbek started his business in the field and cattle breeding. Beginning with the starting amount of 50,000 som (KGS) he rented out land where planted potatoes, beans, and perennial grasses, as well as developed a farm with dairy cows.

In order to further expand his business Tabyshbek has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of bulls. He plans to direct the proceeds from the loan for a subsequent purchase of fertilizers to increase yields.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nyanchok

texts.en:
Nyanchok is 30 years old and is a married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan, for five years.

Nyanchok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is a 48-year-old farmer from Terjola, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his family, including his wife, Tamara, and their adult son and daughter. Amiran’s son is a car mechanic. Tamara has health problems and receives a pension from the government. 

Amiran and Tamara lead the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of their income. The family has two milk cows and two calves. They produce cheese and sell it at the local market. Also, the family owns one hectare of land, where maize is grown. The total average income of the family is 370 GEL per month. 

Amiran requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. This will enable the family to have more milk and increase cheese production and sales by 50 percent. They will have more income and will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is married with five children who all go to school. 

For four years, she has had a retail shop. She has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT -SACCO and wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. Kasifa sells on a retail basis and works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation of commodities from Kampala city to her shop in Natete and increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  

She aspires to seeing her business grow so big that she can own a wholesale shop and a delivery van to facilitate transportation.  Kasifa resides in a rented house and the family has electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Leandre Martin

texts.fr:
Client de 51 ans, marie et père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie ente 5 et 29 ans, 2 sont a l'école et l'aine est a l'université, ayant considéré sa charge , il ouvre une alimentation et a l'obtention de son troisième prêt, elle élargit son activité en ajoutant des chaussures de friperie et tous articles qui intéressent ces clients
Ces differents prêts ont largement contribue a change les conditions de vie de sa vie sociale, ses enfants sont dans les écoles privées, il est entrain d'investir pour ouvrir une grande boutique, ses recettes ont largement augmentes et il fait des épargnes considérables

Tres entreprenant, il veut aller vers loin et il est entrain de s'investir pour construire pour sa maison et s'occuper valablement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman is 50 years old, married, and the father of four children whose ages range from 5 to 29 years. Two of them attend school and the eldest is at university.

Considering his responsibilities, he opened a grocery store and after obtaining his third loan, expanded his business by adding second-hand shoes and all articles of interest to his customers.

These different loans have been instrumental in changing his living conditions and his social life: his children are in private schools, he is about to invest in opening a large store, his income has significantly increased and he is putting a lot into savings.

He is very enterprising and wants to go far. He is currently investing to build himself a home so he can properly care for his children.

loans.use: buy canned goods, non-alcoholic beverages, second-hand clothing, and mineral water

loans.name: Hasna

texts.en:
Hasna is a hard-working 46-year-old woman. She is married, and the mother of two precious children whose living she works very hard to ensure. 

Hasna has been selling perfumes and accessories for three years. With the help of the last Kiva loan that she applied for from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, her business is going well. She was and will be a borrower in good standing. Today, Hasna is applying for another loan from Al Majmoua. This time she will invest it in supporting her newly opened business which is selling used shoes and clothes. She hopes this career will improve her family's social and financial situation.

Hasna hopes to expand her business more and more, and in the future to start in the wholesale trade.

loans.use: To support her newly opened used shoes and clothes business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for six years. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. She generates additional income by renting out rooms. She works in a shop and works seven days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She aspires to seeing her business grow so big that it turns into a wholesale shop. She would also like to buy a van to alleviate her transport problems. Betty lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anna's Group

texts.en:
Akosua is 52 years old. She is divorced and lives in a rented apartment with six children. She has been selling shoes and slip-ons for 11 years. Most of the time, she buys supplies on credit and makes payments after sales.  She wants to use the loan to purchase additional stock and also expand by acquiring a shop. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children’s education. 

Akosua belongs to the community group called PHILIPPIANS Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Bol

texts.en:
Bol is 30 years old and is a married woman with four children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Bor South Sudan for five years.

Bol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase  beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Mackline's Group

texts.en:
Mackline's group is comprised of six hard-working women. Mackline is 17 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Mackline has been working hard to manage her small business, where she cuts fresh fish and sells it to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Mackline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Mackline to generate greater profits and pay her family's bills. Mackline hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Mackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mackline's future prospects by helping her to learn how to write and how to budget money.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother).  Judith requested 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings  from MCDT SACCO with which  she wants to  buy more crates of beer and soda, boxes of mineral water, and jerrycans of local gin. 

Judith has been in this business for ten years. She works in a shop and works seven days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and increasing prices of beer and soda. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and becoming a wholesaler. Judith resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses   include rent, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, boxes of mineral water, and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is 33 years old and is a married woman with four children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor South Sudan for two years.

Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 46 ans , célibataire  avec 3 enfants, a l’arrêt de ses études en terminal , pour subvenir a ses besoins, elle ouvre une boutique d’habits , ou elle vend des chemises, des pantalons, des ensembles de tailleurs ; des bodies et  différents articles de beauté qu’attirent les femmes.
Étant bénéficiaire de Hope depuis bientôt une année, elle a su profiter des ses différents crédits pour renforcer consolider son activité, qui a influencer largement  sa vie sociale et financière, aujourd’hui, elle ne s’endette plus et a son propre capital  pour s’approvisionner.
Ses épargnes sont énormes et elle a fait ses remboursements sans défauts de paiements.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des vêtements pour enfants, adolescents, filles, dames et hommes préparer les fêtes de fin d’année, elle a su fidéliser ses clients en leur offrant des petits présents.
Pour l’avenir, elle est entrain étendre sa boutique et s’occupe de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The client is a 46-year old woman, single with 3 children, who are at a standstill in their studies. In order to meet their needs, she has opened a clothing boutique where she sells shirts, pants, tailored outfits, bodysuits and different types of beauty supplies that attract female clients.
Having been a recipient of Hope for almost one year, she has learned how to take advantage of their different loans to reinforce and strengthen her business, which has largely influenced her social and financial life, such that, today, she is no longer in debt and has her own capital for restocking her shop. 
Her savings are vast and she reimburses without defaulting on the payments. 
With this new loan, she is going to buy clothing for children, teenagers, girls, women and men. In preparation for the end-of-the-year holidays, she has learned to develop loyalty with her clients by offering them little gifts.
Looking to the future, she is in the process of enlarging her shop and taking care of the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children, ladies and men

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a single mother of five children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member. She sells bananas at the market.  

Mwajuma has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for six years and works six days a week and sells on retail basis. Her business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Mwajuma aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and become a wholesale one. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Finangnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FINANGNON est composé de vingt et une personnes qui habitent la même région. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Addifondé est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Addifondé n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Addifondé est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Rémi. Le couple a neuf enfants, dont quatre restent à leur charge. Addifondé et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins de sa famille, Addifondé vend depuis une trentaine d’année, de l’huile de palme, produit issu de la transformation de noix de palme. De façon secondaire, Addifondé vend également de la farine de manioc dans un village du Bénin. Addifondé s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Addifondé et les autres membres de son groupement sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: The FINANGNON association is made up of 21 people living in the same region. The representative of this group is Addifondé, the woman with her hand raised in the photo. In order to ramp up the level of their business and to better meet the demands of their clientele, this group is requesting, for a second time, the financial support of ALIDé. Addifondé never attended school. She is 42-years old and is married to a farmer named Rémi. The couple has 9 children, of which four remain under their care. Addifondé and her husband live together with their children. To contribute to the needs of the family, for roughly 30 years, Addifondé has been selling palm oil, which comes from the palm oil nut. Secondarily, Addifondé also sells manioc flour in a village in Benin. She stocks up in her region. In order to strengthen their business and better satisfy their clients, Addifondé and the other members of the group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their goal is increase the level of their operation.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of palm oil fruit to convert into palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic cups and small plastic buckets to sell.

loans.name: Murtaz

texts.en:
Murtaz is from the village of Simoneti, West Georgia. He is 56 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife – Madona, his fifteen-year-old daughter, thirteen-year-old twin boys and his parents. 

Murtaz works as tinsmith in the village. He makes ovens and different products, which are sold locally. In addition to his main job, Murtaz is actively involved in family farming activities. The family has a milk cow. They produce cheese and sell it locally. Also Murtaz works in the family's 300 sq meter  greenhouse, where greens are grown. The greens are sold locally as well, to greengrocery retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Laris, which includes the monthly pensions of Murtaz's parents.

Murtaz requested credit to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, as the old one is torn and can’t maintain the required temperature. With the new cover, Murtaz will be able to grow high quality greens in the greenhouse and sell them for a good price. This will positively impact on the income of the family. Murtaz will use the additional income to finance the daily expenses of his big family.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is 30 years old and is a married woman with six children. All of them are in school. She has had a small restaurant in Bor South Sudan for four years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a woman of forty-six years, married and a mother of three children. She has a salon and a beauty shop in one of the markets in Nairobi and she has been in this business for eleven years now with a good monthly income which caters for her family's needs.

This will be Petronila's second loan with KADET LTD after she successfully repaid the previous one. She plans to use the entire loan to buy salon equipment and embroidery materials which she ventured into when she made profits in her previous loan. 

In future she would like to build a permanent house for her family at her rural home.

loans.use: To buy hair products for her salon/ beauty shop.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 31-year-old married woman, mother of two children. She has been working as a hairdresser for eight years from her house. She is well known in the region, with her special prices and special customer care she provides.

Sahar is a hardworking woman. She took her house as her working place, just to stay with her children and take good care of her family at the same time.

Sahar is an Al Majmoua, Kiva partner, borrower for the second time. Her previous loan helped a lot in improving her family's living. This time Sahar is requesting a loan to expand her cosmetics and perfume selling sector and to do necessary maintenance to the working room she is using at home.

Sahar hopes to open a beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: To improve her business with special cosmetics & perfumes.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en: Satta is 49 years old and she lives in the Airport community. She has nine children between 22 to 33 years old; three are in college, working and living on their own, while the two younger ones are in school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past fifteen years, Satta has been selling "red oil" in the market, She is requesting a loan to purchase more "red oil" for her business. Her plan is to build her house and send her younger children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more "red oil" (used for cooking) for her business.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Ritah has been working hard to manage her small business, where she smokes fresh fish and sells it at the local market. 

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Ritah to generate greater profits and take care of herself and her child. Ritah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Ritah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Ritah's future prospects by helping her to learn about what it means to be a woman and about finances.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 34 years old. He is married and the father of three children. He is a mixed farmer who has been farming for the past ten years.

He has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more cows. He has been a good client who repaid his previous loan well. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm as well as re-invest in another business. 

He is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 28 years old. He lives in the village of Bardubani (West Georgia) with his parents. Teimuraz works as a fitter in the village. He gets work fitting doors and windows. Along with his main job, Teimuraz is actively involved in family agriculture. The family has two milk cows. They produce cheese and sell it locally to dairy product retailers. The family also has a vineyard of one hectare. Teimuraz and his father make wine, which is sold on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Teimuraz has requested credit to finance some renovation works in his house. After the renovation, the family will enjoy better living conditions and after hard days of work, will be able to spend evenings in a better, more comfortable, house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for renovation of his house.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Margaret has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days a week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and the increasing price of used clothes in Uganda. She aspires to see her business grow and to start importing clothes. 

Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39-year-old a married woman with four children between the ages of 5 and 18. All of her children are in school. For the past three years, Mary has run a clinic in Yei, South Sudan. 

Mary is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase medicines. She will use the extra income generated from her loan to pay for her children to continue to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 67-year-old businessman who is married to Alice, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with an adult child who is 34 years old. For the past 11 years, David has been selling cereals. He earns a monthly income of 4,800 KES which he uses to support his family.

David is applying for his fourth loan with KADET to purchase a stock of dry maize and beans for his business. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. With the anticipated profit from his loan David will expand his business. He hopes to build a storehouse for his cereals to be able to capitalize on sales when prices are low to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother of seven children. All of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She has a business selling bananas. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT - SACCO, which she wants to use to buy more bunches of bananas. Rose works from her home and works seven days a week. She sells on a retail basis and doesn’t have any other income-generating activities. Her business challenges include thieves and seasonality. Rose aspires to see her business grow big and to start selling wholesale only. She stays in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Oliver is requesting a 700,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more food items to sell. She will used the increased profit from her loan to pay fees for her children. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house on her grandmother's land. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Oliver's future prospects by helping her to learn about finance.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell

loans.name: Ephram

texts.en:
Ephraim is 31 years old and is married to Damaris, who is a farmer. The couple is blessed with two children. For the past three years, Ephraim has been a mixed-crop farmer and he also works as a taxi operator. He earns 10,000 KES monthly which he uses to support his family. Ephraim was introduced to KADET by an organization staff member.

Ephraim is applying for his first loan with KADET to buy seedlings and fertilizer to plant maize, bean, cabbages, onions, and tomatoes on his farm. With the anticipated profit from his loan he will educate his children. In the future, Ephraim hopes to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Besta

texts.en:
Besta is a 30-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 4 to 18. For the past three years, she has run a business selling food items in South Sudan. 

Besta is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread and potatoes. She will use the income from her loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase bread and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 54-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and one child who is still attending school. She cooperates with her husband, who works on his own, to be able to cover her child’s educational fees. Fatmeh began giving private lessons from her home in 2000. She has also been a teacher in a local school for the past 21 years. 

Fatmeh is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate her house and prepare a special room for giving educational lessons. In that way, she will be able to improve her family's living standards. In the future, Fatmeh plans to retire and receive her retirement compensation in addition to continuing her private lessons.

loans.use: to renovate her house and create a room for giving lessons

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 25 years old and is married to Eunice, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with one two-year-old child. For the past three years, Robert has been working as a mason in the construction industry. He earns a monthly income of 10,500 KES which he uses to support his family. Robert was introduced to KADET by an organization staff member.

Robert is applying for his first loan with KADET to buy bags of cement and construction bricks. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. In the future, he hopes to buy a piece of land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 26-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Veronica who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child aged five. He has been in the farming business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 7,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Patrick will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a dairy cow. 

He hopes to open a retail shop for his wife which will improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Fattouma

texts.en:
Fattouma is a 55-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her three siblings. They are all joining forces and working really hard to cover the heavy living expenses. Fattouma opened her own mini-market in 2001 and has ten years of experience in this domain. She’s really satisfied with the results she has attained so far. 

Today, she’s looking for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the required quantities of groceries including sugar, soft drinks, cigarettes and many other items. She notes that this Kiva loan will increase her sales thus her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase the required quantities of groceries such as sugar, soft drinks, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 60-year-old business man who is married to Eunice who is a farmer.  They are blessed with three children. He has been running a retail shop for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,500 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Francis will use the loan to buy a stock of maize-meal, sugar and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

He hopes to open a wholesale shop in future which will help him get more profits and thus improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of maize meal, sugar and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more polythene papers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy children’s outfits, dresses, pants, jeans

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Benadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 34-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Joseph, a business man. They are blessed with three children aged 17, 15 and 12 years old respectively. She has been in the farming business for ten years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loan on time. Bernadette will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she plans to buy a dairy cow. 

Her hopes are to own a big tea farm which will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Jovia's Group

texts.en:
Jovia's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Jovia is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Jovia has been working hard to manage her market stand, which sells fresh fruits. 

To help expand her business, Jovia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruit for resale, and will help Jovia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Jovia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Jovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jovia's future prospects by helping her to learn how to succeed.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 8 children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her cousin).    Aisha   has a business selling non-alcoholic drinks.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Aisha sells her products in a shop, retail.

Aisha has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of passion fruit and oranges, soda and boxes of mineral water. The main business challenges for Aisha include rainy season and increasing prices of soda and passion fruit in Uganda.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to  see her  business grow big and open up another branch selling the same non- alcoholic drinks and also to build rental houses.

 Aisha lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, passion fruit and oranges.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 47-year-old businessman who is married to Monica, a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been selling shoes for the past two years with a monthly income of 10,500 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. David will use the loan to buy new shoes to add to his shop and capitalize on the profits during the boom for the Christmas season. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

He hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future and get more profits which will take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy new shoes to add to his shop.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, four of whom are in school. She doesn't take care of any additional family members. 

Margaret has a business of selling used clothes. She has been in this business for one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Margaret sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. She also generates additional income through dry cleaning. The main business challenges for Margaret include the rainy season and the increasing prices of used clothes. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and start importing used clothes. Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, es comerciante de verduras, vive con su esposo, ella tiene más de 10 años de estar dedicado a la venta de verduras, posee un puesto en el mercado municipal, su esposo se dedica a cultivar las verduras en su terreno para evitar comprarla toda para la venta, así se ahorran una cuantas verduras en el negocio.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tomates, papas, güisquiles, yucas, zanahoria, este crédito le ayudara para tener todo lo necesario para cubrir sus gastos y aprovechar la temporada navideña.
La aspiración de Teresa es que este mes venidero sea bueno para la venta, que logre sacar el dinero necesario para pagar las cuotas, para un largo plazo quiere terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is a vegetable vendor. She lives with her husband. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, and has a stall in the municipal market. 

Her husband grows vegetables on his plot of land, to avoid having to buy everything they sell. This way, they save having to buy a few vegetables through the business.

Currently, she is applying for the loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes, güisquiles (pear squash), yucas, and carrots. This loan will help her to have all she needs to cover her expenses, and take advantage of the Christmas season. 

Teresa's desire is that this coming month will be good for sales, so that she manages to get the money necessary to pay her instalments. In the long term, she wants to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, güisquiles (pear squash), yucas, and carrots.

loans.name: Leonisia Isabel

texts.es:
Leonisia, vive con sus tres hijos de 18, 12, 8 años de edad y con su esposo, ella es artesana, elabora ollas, comales, sartenes de barro, también artículos de madera y tela, con pinturas decorativas.
Ella inicio hace tres años, por iniciativa propia, ellos se deciden a formar grupos de personas para fomentar la pintura, hoy en día tienen un taller, donde ofrecen recuadros, recuerdos adornos, llaveros. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como pintura, madera, loza, pinceles y una computadora para hacer bocetos de pintura. Este préstamo le ayudara a ir progresando como microempresaria, contando con las herramientas necesarias para el funcionamiento del taller.
Su aspiración es en un futuro tener clientes en el extranjero y exportar sus productos, así darse a conocer en otros mercados, además quiere educar a los jóvenes para que aprendan este oficio y puedan defenderse con un empleo digno.
texts.en:
Leonisia lives with her three children who are 18, 12 and 8 years of age and with her husband.  She’s a craftswoman.  She makes pots, griddles, and clay pans and also items made of wood and fabric with decorative paintings.

She started three years ago on her own initiative.  They decided to form groups of people to foster painting and today they have a workshop where they sell paintings, keepsakes, decorations and key chains.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy supplies like paint, wood, dinnerware, brushes and a computer to make patterns for paintings.  This loan will help her make progress as a micro businesswoman by having the necessary tools for the workshop’s function.

Her goal for the future is to have customers abroad and to export her products to become known in other markets.  She also wants to teach young people so that they can learn this occupation and be able to support themselves with proper employment.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood, dinnerware, brushes and a computer.

loans.name: July

texts.es: La señora July se dedica a la venta de peluches en la feria principal de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería para poner variedad y ofrecer a su  clientela peluches de varios colores, tamaños y formas en este mes de la navidad. July tiene cuatro hijos que todavía viven con ella .Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Ballivián  de la Ciudad de El Alto. July es cliente de Impro desde el año 2010 y esta es la primera vez que su solicitud de crédito es enviada a Kiva.
texts.en: July sells stuffed toys at the city of El Alto’s main market.  She needs the loan to buy merchandise to have a variety available to offer her customers stuffed toys in various sizes, shapes and colors for this Christmas month.  July has four children still living with her.  She lives in her own house located in the city of El Alto’s Ballivián zone.  July has been an Impro client since 2010 and this is the first time her loan request is sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy assorted stuffed toys.

loans.name: Juana De Dios

texts.es:
Juana, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y ganado, esta labor inicia muy temprano, para iniciar con la comida del ganado, y así sucesivamente realiza las labores todos los días, este negocio y ocupación nace por la necesidad de querer tener una fuente de ingreso desde su hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de comida para cerdo y ganado, ya que quiere disponer de varia cantidad para alimentar los animales por más tiempo, su aspiración es mejorar cada día, crecer con el ganado y poder comercializar a buen precio dichos animales.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her husband and two children.  She raises pigs and cattle.  She starts her work very early beginning with feeding the cattle.  She does this work successively every day.  The business and the occupation arose from the need she had to have a source of income for her household.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed for pigs and cattle because she wants to have a good amount on hand for a long time.  Her goal is to improve every day, to grow with the cattle to be able to sell them for good prices.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 38-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and only one child. He's considered as the main source of income in the family and is working really hard to provide a better future for his young child. 

He started his own metal works in 2003 and has already a total of eighteen years of experience in this domain. Today, he needs a loan of $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added metalworking equipment for his business. He's certain that this Kiva loan will increase his profits by 15%. In the future, he plans to open his own metal shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional metalworking equipment for his business

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

Resty has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Resty sells her products from home, by means of retail. Resty has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Resty include seasonality and thieves. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and become a wholesaler. Resty lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees for her grandchildren and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: La señora Shirley es comerciante, tiene una tienda de cristalería y artículos navideños. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más mercadería, como ser sets de vasos de cristal, adornos navideños, para poner variedad y ofrecerla  a su  clientela y aprovechar las fiestas navideñas. Shirley es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa de sus abuelos la misma queda ubicada en la zona Gran Poder de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito a través de IMPRO y la segunda vez que se lo canaliza a través de  Kiva.
texts.en: Shirley is a merchant.  She has a glassware and Christmas decorations store.  She needs the loan to buy more merchandise like sets of crystal drinking glasses and Christmas decorations to have a variety of goods to offer her customers taking advantage of the Christmas festivities.  Shirley is single and has a son.  She lives in her grandparents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Gran Poder zone.  This is her fifth lmpro loan request and the second time it’s been channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy glassware and Christams decorations.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband, three children and one relative. Her husband and two of her children are employed, and Ferial has been farming on her own land since 1980.

A good farmer who knows very well how to deal with agricultural problems that arise, she is requesting a loan of $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her land. Ferial notes that this will boost her productivity and thus her revenues, and in the future, she plans to open her own vegetable-vending shop.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her land.

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
María, vive con dos hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad, además vive con su esposo, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja a tiempo completo porque lo tiene instalado en su propia casa.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como azúcar, frijoles, huevos, sal, entre otros, esta inversión le brindara un crecimiento al negocio y mejorara su atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de María es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, para que se superen y tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
María lives with two children who are 19 and 16 years of age; she also lives with her husband.  She runs a general store.  The business arose from her own initiative.  She works full-time because it’s home-based.

She is asking for a loan at present to buy merchandise like sugar, beans, eggs and salt, among others.  This investment will provide growth for the business and improve her customer service.

María’s hope is that her children stay in school so that they will improve themselves and have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, eggs and salt.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La señora Sofía se dedica a la venta de peluches en la feria principal de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más mercadería para poner variedad y ofrecer a su  clientela peluches de varios colores, tamaños y formas en la época de navidad. Sofía tiene tres   hijos de los cuales uno de ellos ya es independiente .Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona  16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto. Sofía es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008 y esta es la primera vez que su solicitud se envía a  Kiva.
texts.en:
Sofía sells stuffed animals at the main fair in the city of El Alto.

The loan that she needs is to buy more merchandise in order to put out more variety.  She wants to offer her customers different colors, sizes, and shapes of stuffed animals for the Christmas season.

Sofía has three children; one of them is already independent.  She lives in her parents’ house in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto.

Sofía has been a client of Impro since 2008.  This is the first time that her request has been sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy different colors, shapes, and sizes of stuffed animals to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita, se dedica a la venta de frutas al por menor. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de  capital y poder comprar más frutas de la estación, como plátano, mango, piña, papaya. Margarita  es casada y tiene cinco  hijos. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Huayna Potosí  de la Ciudad de El Alto. Margarita ya ha cancelado dos préstamos anteriores en forma excelente y califica para un nuevo crédito. Esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud se envía a  Kiva.
texts.en: Margarita is a fruit retailer.  She needs the loan to increase capital and be able to buy more seasonal fruit like bananas, mangoes, pineapples and papayas.
