She has a small place in her home where she places all variety of available snacks to offer to her different customers.  She began selling only caramels, but little by little, [her business] grew and now she offers greater variety.  She has her husband at her side as her faithful companion, and with him, she has worked hard to be able to provide an education for their children.  It is going very well for her since she sells a lot during the school year.  Like all good women with the will to overcome, she has many projects in mind.  Though she is advanced in age, she wishes to continue growing with her business and selling a greater variety of things.  This will be her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since with this she will feel confident to advance with her business.  On the other hand, she promises to complete her monthly payments.  She is very happy to belong to her community bank since all [the members] are very kind and people that have solidarity with each other.  With the amount of 1000 soles requested, she will purchase snacks and some other products in order to start to sell a greater variety in her small place.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and sodas.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 40 años, es una mujer amable y muy entusiasta, esta separada de su pareja y tiene que criar a uno de sus dos hijos ella sola. Su hija tiene 4 años mientras que su hijo el mayor tiene 16 y vive en otra ciudad a lado de sus abuelos, pero ella vive en casa de su hermana. El trabajo de Rosario consiste en la venta de abarrotes y comida en su casa, todos los días muy temprano abre sus puertas, limpia y ordena sus productos, ahí espera que vengan sus clientes en busca de todos los tipos de productos que ofrece. Además de tener su tienda de abarrotes, también se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos, todos estos trabajos los realiza sola y lo lleva haciéndolo por cinco años. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que siempre le encantó cocinar y estar en contacto con la gente. Ahora le va muy bien, aunue no siempre fue así, al principio como no conocía mucho el negocio tenía muchas dificultades, pero con el tiempo pudo superarlos y ahora es una gran comerciante. Tiene muchos planes a futuro pero el principal es ampliar su tienda y así vender mayor variedad de productos. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez más en pagar de manera puntual con sus cuotas y demostrar como en anteriores oportunidades que es una socia muy buena y así retribuir el apoyo que le brindan en su banco comunal en donde todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará abarrotes para tener en stock en su tienda, además de algunos ingredientes e insumos para continuar con la preparación de los platos de comida que ofrece.
texts.en:
Rosario, 40, is a friendly and enthusiastic woman.  She is separated from her partner and has to raise one of her two children on her own, her 4-year old daughter.  Her son is 16 and he lives in another city with his grandparents, but Rosario lives in her sister’s house.  
She sells groceries and food in her house.  She opens very early, cleans and orders the products.  There she waits for her customers to come looking for all the different kinds of food that she sells.  Besides having her grocery store, she also sells breakfasts and lunches.  She has done all this work by herself for five years.
She really likes what she does because she has always loved cooking and being with people.  It’s going well for her, although it wasn’t always this way.  At the beginning, since she didn’t know much about business, she had a lot of problems.  But after some time she was able to handle them and now she is a great businesswoman.  
She has many plans for the future but the main one is to enlarge her store and that way she can sell a greater variety of products.
This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is hoping for your help so that she can continue with her goals.  For this she promises again to make her payments on time, and she has shown with previous financing that she is a very good member and returns the support that the communal bank offers her.  All the members of the bank are responsible and united. 
 She will use the 1500 sols requested to buy groceries to  stock her store, and also to purchase some ingredients and supplies to continue with the preparation of the meals that she offers.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store and also basic ingredients to prepare the food that she makes

loans.name: Rosa Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Hermelinda, tiene 34 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene  3 hijos, se dedica al la artesanía, a la elaboración de calzado para mujeres, inicio este trabajo por iniciativa propia, lleva 5 años e experiencia en realizar este trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizar como capital de trabajo para iniciar su propio negocio, para la compra de piel, cuerina, forro, adornos, suelas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Rosa Hermelinda is 34 years old and completed four years of primary school.  She has three children.  She is a craftswoman, making footwear for women, and she started doing this work on her own initiative.  She has been in this business for five years.

She is seeking a loan so she can have working capital to start her own business. The funds will be used to buy leather, cloth, decorative items, soles, etc. She hopes in the future to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make sandals.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, de 27 años, es una mujer buena y amable, esta casada y tiene tres hijos de 7, 2 años y el menor de 10 meses, ella junto a su esposo y sus hijos vive en una casa propia en donde comparten todos los días la alegría de ver crecer a su familia. El trabajo de Rosmery consiste en la venta de comida, ella muy temprano sale al mercado en busca de los mejores ingredientes ya que le gusta brindar lo mejor a sus clientes, una vez que tiene todos los ingredientes seleccionados por sus mágicas manos, comienza a preparar los platos que ofrecerá, al terminar su preparación lleva todo lo preparado a los aserraderos de la ciudad en donde comienza a vender, tiene el gusto de atender solo a pedidos ya que su exquisita sazón hace que tenga muchos clientes. Se inició vendiendo de a poco hace tres años ya que tenía la necesidad de aportar económicamente al hogar.
Esta muy contenta con su trabajo ya que le permite tener muy bueno ingresos, lo hace sola y le da tiempo de descansar tranquila y brindar el tiempo a su familia, tiene muchos planes para su futuro pero el que es mas a corto plazo es el de poner un restaurante para no tener que estar yendo a lugares lejanos a vender, pero sabe que es algo que tendrá que hacer con mucho capital y por ello trabajara mucho para poder juntar e iniciar con su proyecto. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con lo que hace, además se compromete a realizar el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el  monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con su trabajo, además de algunas verduras y productos no perecibles.
texts.en:
Rosmery, age 27, is a good and friendly woman. She is married and has three children, ages 7, 2, and, the youngest, 10 months. She lives with her husband and children in their own house where they share happiness every day in seeing their family grow.

Rosmery’s work consists of selling meals. She leaves very early for the market where she looks for the best ingredients since she likes to offer the best to her customers. Once she has all the selected ingredients her magic hands begin to prepare the dishes she will offer. Upon finishing her preparation, she takes everything she has made to the saw mills in the city where she begins to sell. She has the pleasure of serving only based on orders since her exquisite flavor makes her have many customers. She began selling about three years ago since she needed to contribute economically to the household.

Rosmery is very happy with her work since it permits her to have very good earnings. She does her work alone, and it gives her the time to rest peacefully and offer time to her family. She has many plans for the future, but for the short term her plan is to have a restaurant so that she doesn’t have to sell at places far from home. She knows that this is something for which she will need a lot of capital, and that’s why she will work hard in order to bring it together and begin her project.

This will be her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support since she will feel more certain of progressing with what she does. In addition, she promises to make all her payments in a timely fashion. With the sum applied for (1000 soles) she will buy ingredients and resources in order to continue with her work, including some vegetables and nonperishable products.

loans.use: to purchase basic materials for preparing food, including vegetables and nonperishable products.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el Barrio 15 De Septiembre de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, con un clima cálido, por su gastronomía y por sus innumerables atractivos turísticos, cada 15 días  se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer.
  
Aquí conocimos a María, tiene 22 años  de edad, está soltera y estudia Administración De Empresas en una Universidad de Manta. Vive en casa de sus padres.  Lleva más de 4 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que el brinda el banco  para seguir adelante en su negocio.

Ella es  una linda jovencita que además de dedicarse a sus estudios también junto con su mamá se dedican al comercio, venden joyas laminadas en oro que compran en la ciudad de Guayaquil y luego en su domicilio entregan a otros comerciantes minoristas que distribuyen por toda la ciudad. Ellas venden al por mayor, dan crédito y cobran a los quince días o a fin de mes. Llevan más de 7 años dedicadas a esta actividad y les va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar joyas laminadas en oro.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser empresaria.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the Communal Bank, Palabra De Mujer (Woman's Word) meet in the15th District of the city of Manta.  Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited at any time of year by domestic and foreign tourists.With a warm climate, it's also known for its cuisine and its many tourist attractions.
  
Here we met María, who is 22 years old, unmarried and studied business administration at a university in Manta.  She lives with her parents. She has been in the communal bank for more than 4 years and likes the support the bank provides to help her move forward in her business.

María is a lovely girl who is pursuing her studies. Along with her mother, she also works in business, selling gold laminated jewelry that they buy in the city of Guayaquil and then at home deliver the goods to other retailers that distribute throughout the city . They sell wholesale, give credit and then collect every 15 days or at month-end. They have been in business for over 7 years and do very well.

This loan will be used to buy jewelry laminated in gold.  María's dreams are to complete her studies and become an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy gold laminated jewelry.

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
Williams, de 46 años, es una hombre bueno, amable y muy trabador, esta casado y tiene un hijo quien tiene 18 años y es su motivo de inspiración ya que su máximo deseo es darle una profesión. Él vive en su casa propia a lado de su hijo, su esposa y su suegro a quienes brinda lo necesario para tener una beuna calidad de vida. El trabajo de Williams consiste en brindar el servicio de electricista, además de ser mecánico, también se dedica al transporte ya que sale a trabajar en su unidad móvil. Siempre esta a la expectativa ya que sus clientes le llaman muy seguido a los diferentes talleres de la ciudad para brindar sus servicios de mecánico  y así brindar sus conocimientos a los mecánico nuevos y jóvenes. Trabaja solo y le esta yendo muy bien, al principio solo se dedicaba al transporte pero con el tiempo fue ganando experiencia además de conocimientos.
Lo bueno de su trabajo es que tiene entradas de dinero por todos lados, si no esta brindando sus servicios de electricista, esta laborando como mecánico o sino ofreciendo el servicio de transporte. Tiene muchas cosas en mente en cuanto a su actividad pero por el momento solo se esta concentrando en aperturar una asociación de mototaxista en donde pueda brindar algunos repuestos y servicios a crédito a sus demás colegas de trabajo. Este será el crédito numero 3 con MFP, por ello esta muy contento ya que tendrá un apoyo financiero y así podrá seguir avanzando con su negocio, además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, por otro lado menciona estar muy contento de trabajar junto a su banco comunal ya que todos sus socios son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mercadería para poner una tienda de repuestos de motos en su casa y así empezar a concretizar uno de sus objetivos trazados.
texts.en:
Williams who is a very good man is 46 years old. He is friendly and a hard worker. He is married and has an 18 year old child who is his source of inspiration and his greatest desire is to give his child a vocation. He lives in his own house, along side of his child and his wife and his father-in-law,  providing what is necessary to have a good quality of life.

Williams is an electrician and also a mechanic, and he also works in haulage and uses his cell phone to conduct his business. He is always on the alert as his customers call him continuously to various workshops around the city in order to offer mechanical help and advice passing along his knowledge to new and young mechanics. He works alone and is doing very well, at first only working in haulage, but with time he gained experience and knowledge.

The good thing about his work is that he has several sources of income. If he is not offering his services as an electrician then he is working as a mechanic or else providing haulage service. He has many things in mind regarding work activities, but at the moment he only is concentrating on launching a motorcycle taxi driver association where he can provide some repairs and services on credit to his work colleagues.

This will be his 3rd loan with MFP, so he is very happy that he will have financial support and thus be able to continue moving forward with his business. Also he promises to once again make his loan payments, as he has done with previous loans he has had. At the same time he mentions that he is very happy to work with the communal bank because all the members are very trustworthy and caring. With the 2500 soles from the loan, he will buy merchandise in order to be able to open a motorcycle spare parts store in his home and thus begin to actualize one of his planned objectives.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles to begin a business

loans.name: Sucena Narcisa

texts.es:
En el Barrio 15 De Septiembre de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, con un clima cálido, por gastronomía y por sus innumerables atractivos turísticos, cada 15 días  se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. 
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sucena, tiene 53 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo sola, pero de esta relación tuvo 10 hijos, 9 ya son mayores e independientes y con ella solo vive el menor que tiene 10 años y estudia en escuela.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida desde hace seis años en su casa puso una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde sus clientes pueden conseguir todo lo que necesitan ya que la tiene bien surtida con la finalidad de cada dia ir ganando mas clientela, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, le encanta su negocio ya que además de ganarse la vida se distrae y también está al tanto de las necesidades de su hijo y el cuidado de su hogar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más
texts.en:
The city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are highly frequented throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists.  The city is also known for its hot climate, fine food, and numerous tourist attractions.  The members of the Palabra de Mujer communal bank meet every 15 days in the city’s 15th of September neighborhood.

Sucena is 53 year old.  Her husband passed away several years ago, leaving her a widow.  From that relationship she has 10 children, 9 of whom are adults and live independently.  Only her youngest son lives with her—he is 10 years old and is in school.  

For six years Sucena has operated a small grocery store in her home to earn a living.  Her customers can get everything they need there, since she keeps it well stocked in order to gain more customers each day.  She works from 6:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening.  She thoroughly enjoys her business, since it is a way to earn a living as well as to pass the time, and it provides for all of her son’s needs and for the upkeep of their home.

Sucena will use this loan to stock her store with more merchandise, including rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other basic staple products.  She has been a member of her communal bank since it was founded, and she likes it because she has made many friends in the group.

Sucena’s goal is to get ahead in her business and for her store to grow more each day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other staple products.

loans.name: Mónica Mirelly

texts.es:
En el Barrio 15 De Septiembre de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, con un clima cálido, por su gastronomía y por sus innumerables atractivos turísticos, cada 15 días  se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer.
  
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mónica, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  19 y 8 años de edad, el menor estudian en escuela y ambos aun vive con ella ya que el mayor es especial y requiere de muchos cuidados. Su esposo es empleado público.

Ella trabaja en una  empresa en la ciudad de Manta y también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en su casa y también vende en su lugar de trabajo. Ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 15 días, su mercadería la compra en Manta, Guayaquil o Huaquillas según lo que necesita para vender.  Lleva más de 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

 Su sueño es darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Palabra de Mujer" meets every 15 days in the "15 de Septiembre" neighborhood of the city of Manta, a place that is known for beautiful beaches that attract national and international tourists in every season of the year.  Manta is known for its warm climate, cuisine, and many tourist attractions.

Here we meet Monica, who is 40 years old.  She is married, and she and her husband have two children aged 19 and 8.  The youngest is in school and both of them live with her, since the older child has special needs and requires a lot of care.  Her husband works for the government. 

Monica works in a company in the city of Manta, and she also has a business selling all types of clothing.  She makes most of her sales from her house, and she also sells at her place of work.  She sells on credit, and collects every 15 days.  She buys her merchandise in  Manta, Guayaquil or Huaquillas, depending on what she needs for her sales.  She has been working in this business for 5 years, and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.  She has been a member of her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because the loans have been very helpful to her. 

Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Denisse Lisbeth

texts.es:
En el Barrio 15 De Septiembre de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, con un clima cálido, por su gastronomía y por sus innumerables atractivos turísticos, cada 15 días  se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer.
  
Aquí conocimos a Denisse, tiene 19 años  de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de  dos años de edad. Vive en casa de sus padres y estudia el primer semestre de Auditoria en una Universidad de Manta. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque le están ayudando mucho con los créditos para salir adelante.

Ella además de estudiar también se dedica a su negocio con el cual puede pagar sus estudios y cubrir las necesidades a su hijo. Hace un año atrás solicito un crédito al banco comunal con el cual comenzó su negocio de comidas rápidas en su casa, vende hamburguesas, hot dog, batidos de fruta, tostadas entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días en las tardes y noches, su mamá le ayuda en su negocio cuando esta muy ocupada. En  su negocio le va muy bien y gracias a esto ella esta saliendo adelante con la dura carga de criar a un hijo sola.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The members of the “Palabra De Mujer” communal bank meet every two weeks in the neighborhood known as “15 de Septiembre,” located in the city of Manta, known for its lovely beaches that are visited by tourists year round because of the warm climate, good food, and tourist attractions.

Here we meet Denisse.  She’s 19 years old and the single mother of a two year old boy.  She lives with her parents and is in her first semester of studying to be an auditor at the University of Manta.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she enjoys it because they’re helping her greatly with the loans that help her get ahead.

Aside from studying, she has a business so that she can pay her education expenses and cover her son’s needs.  She requested a loan through the communal bank a year ago, which allowed her to start her fast food business at home.  She sells hamburgers, hot dogs, fruit smoothies, and tostadas, among other things.  She works every evening and her mother helps her with the business when she gets very busy.

Things are going well for her in her business and thanks to it she’s getting ahead with the task of having to raise her son alone.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients to prepare her foods.  Her dreams are to finish her education and provide the best for her son.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Aura Lucrecia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lucrecia, ella tiene  34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 7 y de 3 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una muy buena esposa y ama de casa que también se dedica a la venta productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva 5 años en su negocio y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes. Ella también le da una parte del crédito a su esposo para que compre materiales para la pesca y pueda realizar una buena faena.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, redes, anzuelos y otros materiales de pesca. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por los beneficios que les da el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un barco más grande para que su marido realice sus labores de pesca.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Mar” communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful San Mateo spa in San Mateo, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are well visited year round by national and foreign tourists.  Most of the residents of this area are fishermen and work on other tasks on the sea.

Here we meet Lucrecia.  She’s 34 years old, married and has three children, ages 12, 7, and 3.  The oldest attend school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She’s a good wife and housekeeper and also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories).  She works three days a week, sells on credit and collects every week.  She’s been doing this for five years and her business is doing well.  Perfumes are her best selling item.  She will share some of the loan with her husband so that he can buy fishing supplies so that he can do his work better.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, nets, hooks and other fishing items.  She’s been a member of the communal bank since it began and she likes the benefits.  Her dream is to have a bigger boat so that her husband can fish.

loans.use: to buys cosmetics and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Miguel es soltero, tiene 24 años de edad, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para capital de trabajo, y ampliar su negocio, para la compra de mercadería y así, mejorar sus ganancia. Específicamente para la compra de ropa, como chumpas, suéteres, camisas, playeras, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Pedro Miguel is 24 years old, single, and has been selling second hand clothing for seven years.

He’s asking for a loan to use as working capital to expand his business.  He will buy merchandise in order to improve his earnings.  Specifically he’ll buy things like jackets, sweaters, shirts, t-shirts, etc.  He hopes for a large business in the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Lina Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lina, ella tiene  49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos ellos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos. Trabaja todos los días,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra en dos partes. Su mercadería  la compra en Manta o en   Guayaquil cuando puede. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal 3 años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y que su esposo y sus hijos siempre tengan buena pesca.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Mar” communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful San Mateo spa in San Mateo, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are well visited year round by national and foreign tourists.  Most of the residents of this area are fishermen and work on other tasks on the sea.

Here we meet Lina.  She’s 49 years old, married and has five adult children.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She sells clothing of all types, door to door, in order to earn some income on her own and help with the household expenses.  She also sells from her home, where customers go to buy from her.  She works every day and sells on credit, collecting in two parts.  She buys her merchandise in Manta or Guayaquil as she’s able.  She’s been doing this for three years and things are going well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she likes it because she was able to start her business with her first loan.

Her dreams are for good health and for her husband and sons to have good catches (fish).

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El señor Luis Manuel del de 46 años esta casado con la señora Patricia, tiene 3 hijos en edad que actualmente están estudiando el es herrero cuenta con un negocio propio el cual le permite cubrir los gastos familiares y de educación de sus hijos. El tiene la necesidad de comprarle una computadora a sus hijos gasta alrededor de $100.00 diarios en renta de equipos de computo e impresiones para que sus hijos elaboren sus tareas el ha estado ahorrando para comprar una computadora para sus hijos el se las había prometido para DICIEMBRE y es fecha en que no le alcanza con sus ahorros para comprarla y solicita el apoyo para que le puedan dar para apoyar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Señor Luis Manuel is 46 years old and married to Señora Patricia. He has 3 children who are of school age and are currently studying. He is a blacksmith, a trade that allows him to cover his household expenses and his children's education. He needs to buy a computer for his children. He spends around $100.00 daily to rent computer equipment and on printing so that his children can complete their assignments. He has been saving to buy a computer for his children. He had promised them one for December, however, he doesn't have enough saved at this date to buy it. He is asking for help so as to support his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Clarita Martha

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Clarita, ella tiene  38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 23, 22 y de 12 años de edad, su último hijo  estudia en escuela, los dos menores aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta productos Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres o cuatro días de la semana y aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores de alta mar ya que en esos días ellos tiene bastante dinero y es cuando más compran, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Lleva más de 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde que se inicio el grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. The area is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited year-round by national and international tourists, and the majority of the local inhabitants either fish or make their living from the sea.

Here we meet Clarita, who is thirty-eight years old, married with three children, ages twenty-three, twenty-two, and twelve. Her youngest child is in school, and the two youngest still live at home. Her husband is a businessman.

In order to earn something on her own, she sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies’ accessories). She sells door-to-door, working three or four days a week. When the fisherman return from the high seas with lots of money, she makes the most sales, leaving items on credit and collecting weekly payments. She has worked this way for seven years and her business is good.

She will use this loan to purchase perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, and creams. She has been a member of the Communal Bank since its inception, and she enjoys it because her companions are very polite.

Her dream is for her business to continue to improve.

loans.use: To purchase perfume, cosmetics, jewelry and creams.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Diana de 25 años es casada tiene 2 hijos uno de 9 años y otro de 7 años  vive en una casa de interés social y se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, artículos para el hogar y juguetes usados esta es la fuente de ingresos con la que ella puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ella vende sus productos en diferentes colonias donde se reúnen varios comerciantes y exhiben sus productos para vender. Diana es una mujer muy emprendedora y requiere comprar juguetes y ropa de temporada como pants, chaquetas, tenis, sudaderas para esta temporada navideña y de invierno y así poder incrementar sus ventas y obtener un ingreso mayor para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Diana is twenty-five years old, married with two children, ages nine and seven, and lives in a house in a low-income community. She sells used clothes, shoes, items to be used in the home, and toys. Through this source of income she is able to help her husband cover living costs. She sells her products in different neighborhoods where retailers meet and offer their wares. Diana is a very enterprising woman and needs to purchase toys and seasonal clothing such as pants, jackets, tennis shoes, and sweaters for winter and the Christmas season. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and earn more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Fanny Nancy

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Fanny, tiene 47 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Lleva  4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a pesar de que no tiene el respaldo de un esposo.

Ella ha tenido que luchar muy duro para salir adelante sola con sus dos hijos, ya que ella fue padre y madre a la vez, le ha tocado trabajar realizando quehaceres domésticos en una casa en Manta, pero también con unos pocos recursos que tenía hace varios años empezó un negocio de venta de ropa, el mismo que lo hacía puerta a puerta, luego su hijo empezó a ayudarle con sus ventas y ahora  tiene un local en Manta en el cual junto a su hijo venden ropa de todo tipo. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio local ya que el que tienen  es arrendado.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. The area is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited year-round by national and international tourists, and the majority of the local inhabitants either fish or make their living from the sea.

Here we meet Fanny, who is 47 years old, a single mother with two grown children, one of which still lives with her. She has already received four loans through the Communal Bank, and she is happy for the help which it has given her despite the fact that she does not have the backing of a husband.

She has had to struggle very hard to get ahead by herself with her two children, especially since she was both mother and father for them. She has worked doing domestic housework in a house in Manta, but with the few resources she had several years ago, she started a business selling clothes, which she does door-to-door. Later, her son began to help her with her sales, and now she has a shop in Manta, where, together with her son, she sells all kinds of clothing.

She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.

Her dream is to have her own store, since she leases the one she has now.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Santa Elvira

texts.es: La señora Santa Elvira de 40 años es Divorciada y vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 10 años, tiene dos hijos menores de edad que aun dependen económicamente de ella, Elvira obtiene ingresos de dos medios uno recibiendo una comisión por venta de boletos de autobús para viajar a distintos lugares de México y el otro y principal ingreso para ella y su familia es como distribuidora independiente de productos alternativos para  el cuidado de la salud; desde hace un año ella tiene un club de nutrición en su domicilio en el cual ella prepara los productos que el vende como desayunos y se los entrega a sus clientes desde las 7 de la mañana ellos pasan a su domicilio antes de irse a sus trabajos; La señora Santa requiere el apoyo para compra de mas productos para su club de nutrición y asi poder incrementar sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo apoyar a las familias de la localidad a mejoras sus condiciones de salud.
texts.en:
Santa Elvira, is 40, divorced, and has been living in subsidized housing for ten years. She has two minor children, who still depend on her financially. 

Elvira obtains income by two means. One is through receiving commission on the sale of bus tickets for travelling to different places in Mexico. The  other, and principal income for her and her family, is from being an independent distributor of alternative health care products. 

She has had a nutrition club in her home for a year. This is where she prepares the products she sells as breakfasts, and distributes to her customers. From seven in the morning, they drop by her home before going to work. 

Santa needs the support, in order to buy more products for her nutrition club. In this way she will be able to increase her income, and at the same time help the families in her neighborhood to improve their health.

loans.use: To buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: Nancy Lizeth

texts.es: Nancy Lizeth de 26 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos desde hace seis años vive en una casa de interés social su esposo trabaja en una compañía de Gas butano y ella para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace seis años al ver las carencias económicas que había en su hogar decidio emprender un negocio el cual le permitiera atender su hogar y al mismo apoyar a la economía familiar y decidio vender ropa de marca entre sus amistades como lo son chaquetas, playeras, pans y bolsas de dama y asi ir  apoyando con los gastos del hogar, la mercancía que ella vende la compra en estados unidos y la vende entre sus amigos, conocidos y afuera de su domicilio; SOLICITA el apoyo para compra de mercancía te temporada como lo son sudaderas de marca para este invierno.
texts.en:
Nancy Lizeth is 26, married, and has two children. She has lived in subsidized housing for six years. Her husband works for a company selling butane gas.

Six years ago, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, and on seeing the financial scarcities at home, she decided to launch a business, that would enable her to look after her household, and at the same time support the family finances. 

She decided to sell brand name clothing such as jackets, T-shirts, pants, ladies' handbags; and in this way start helping with the household expenses. 

She buys the merchandise she sells, in the United States, and sells it to her friends, acquaintances, and outside her home. 

She is applying for the loan to buy seasonal merchandise for this winter, such as brand name sweatshirts.

loans.use: To buy cold weather clothing such as pants, jackets, and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Rosa Esilda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar esta a la señora Rosa, ella tiene  56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera de la localidad.

Ella  tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad, a pesar de que su tienda es pequeña sus clientes consiguen de todo, ese es el éxito para tener cada día mas clientes,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. En su negocio se entretiene con sus amistades y conocidos que llegan todos los días  hasta su local,  tiene su negocio 10 años y que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Es fundadora del  Banco Comunal hace más de 15 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen Del Mar meets every 15 days at the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta known for its beautiful beaches which are well-visited at any time of the year by foreign and domestic tourists alike. Here the majority of the inhabitants work in fishing and other sea-related activities.

Here is Señora Rosa. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 children from the relaionship, all of which are adult and independent. Her husband works at a local gas station.

She has a grocery store in her house. She sells items such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents among other staple products. Despite her store being small, her customers can find everything they need there. This is what she strives for to have more custimers every day. She works every day from 06:00 to 20:00 hours and sometimes even later. During business hours, she spends time with friends and acquiantances who come to her shop every day. She has had her business for more than 10 years and she is doing well. 

She is going to use this loan to further stock her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, among other staple products. She was a founding member of the communal bank more than 15 years ago and she likes it because she has made a lot of friends in the group.

Her goals are to get ahead with her business and grow her store more every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and sausages and other staple products.

loans.name: Zoila Obdulia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Zoila, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad que estudian en  escuela Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella tiene un negocio de venta de materiales de pesca como por ejemplo redes, anzuelos, piolas, plomos, arpones,  entre  otras muchas cosas que se requieren para realizar una buena pesca en alta mar, trabaja tres días de la semana y su forma es ofrecer sus productos a los pescadores una vez que llegan de alta mar. Cada quince días viaja hasta el centro de Manta a comprar lo necesario para que cuando lleguen sus clientes tener de todo para ellos, lleva 4 años en  esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, entre otros materiales para la pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó este negocio.

Su sueño es comprar una lancha para la pesca.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Virgen Del Mar mets every 15 days in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are well-visited by foreign and domestic tourists alike. Here most of the inhabitants work in fishing and sea-related activites. 

Here we met Señora Zoila. She is 31 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 10 and 8, from the relationship, who study at school. Her husband is a fisherman.

She has a small business selling fishing equipment for example: nets, hooks, lead weights, harpoons among the many things needed to make a good catch at sea. She works 3 days a week and her way of doing business is to provide the fishermen with thier products on their return from high sea. Every 15 days she travels to the centre of Manta to buy supplies for her customers so that she has everything ready for when her customers arrive. She has been doing this for 4 years and she is doing very well as she has a lot of clients.

This loan is for buying nets, lanyards, hooks and cramp irons among other fishing equipment. She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years and she likes it as with her first loan she started this business.

Her dream is to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy nets, lanyards, hooks, cramp irons and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Hilario es casado tiene tres hijos y desde hace 7 años vive en una casa de interés social trabaja como operador de maquinas en una maquiladora de la localidad hace menos de un año el trabaja de 6:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde de lunes a viernes con lo que el gana no les alacanza a el y  a su familia para cubrir cubrir las necesidades  básicas del hogar y su esposa Gloria se vio en la necesidad de tener que buscar un empleo el cual le permitiera apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, para Hilario ha sido complicado el tener que cubrir la educación de sus hijos, los gastos de alimentación, el pago de servicios y hacerle las mejoras que requiere su hogar es por ello que solicitan el apoyo para pintar su casa por dentro y por fuera.
texts.en: Hilario is married, has 3 children and has lived in an environmentally friendly house for the last 7 years. He has worked for less than a year as a machine operator in a local components factory. He works from 6:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the aftrenoon from Monday to Friday. He does not earn enough to cover his and his familiy's basic household needs and his wife, Gloria, found it necessary to seek employment to allow her to suport her husband with the hosuehold expenses. Hilario has found it difficult to pay for his children's education, food, services and make the neccessary improvements his house needs. This is why they are asking for help to paint their house inside and out.

loans.use: to buy paint to improve his house.

loans.name: Julissa Annabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Julissa, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una niña de dos  años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Ella lleva más de dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque es por estos créditos que tiene su negocio ya que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes los cuales le realizan muchos pedidos. Trabaja dos días de la semana y aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores para  realizar sus ventas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería compra en Manta o en Guayaquil cada que necesita, ella lleva dos años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas y ropa interior.

Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen Del Mar meets every 15 days at the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta known for its beautiful beaches visited by foreign and domertic tourists alike. Here most of the inhabitants work in fishing and sea-related activities.

Here we met Señora Julissa who is 22 years old and married. From this relationship she has a 2 year old daughter. He husband is a fisherman. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than 2 years and she likes it because by virtue of these loans she has a business as she started her business with the first loan she received from the communal bank.

She sells clothes of all kinds. She sells door-to-door and also from her house where customers who have placed a lot of orders come to collect. She works 2 days a week and she takes advantage of when the fishermen return to make her sales. She gives credit to her cutomers and receives payment every 15 days. She buys her goods in Manta or Guayaquil when she needs to. She has had her business for 2 years and she is doing well.

With this loan she will buy pants, shirts, vests, blouses and underwear.

Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, vests, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Crisanta is married and has nine adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Crisanta owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Crisanta is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. In 2006, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Jiesse

texts.en:
Jiesse is married with three children. Jiesse is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Jiesse is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years and every month he earn 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Jiesse has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Jiesse hopes to help his children finish their studies and to double his income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Chona owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Chona has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Chona is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of her motorcycle.

In 2010, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the cost paid for maintenance and repair of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is from Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and single.

To make a living, Carmela owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Carmela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. 

Crisanta is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. In 2009, Carmela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her piggery business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Betty works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. Betty is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more scrap or recycled materials to sell in her business.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more scrap or recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Editha is married with two children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Editha  as been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Editha joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie 32 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Rubie runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, and soaps. Rubie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month.

Rubie is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Rubie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta is 39 years old and married with two children. Crisanta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000-Philippine-peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store. Crisanta has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Crisanta aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a married woman who has three children. Helen is 48 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Helen owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been in this business for eight years. Each month, she earns 15,000 Philippine pesos doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 30,000 pesos to purchase products to resell. Helen has been a member of GDMPC for seven years. In the future, Helen wants to have a big house and buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, married, and has two school-age children. To make a living, Marilyn has been engaged in a flower-planting and pot-display business for over five years, earning approximately 7,000 Philippine-pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more pots to display. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, and she hopes to make a flower shop.

loans.use: to purchase more pots to display

loans.name: Florephis

texts.en:
Florephis is 36 years old and married with two children.

Florephis works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Florephis has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns extra income from raising pigs.

Florephis aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items, such as shampoo and groceries, to sell in her sari-sari store.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns extra income from raising pigs.

Gloria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as shampoo and groceries, for resale.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 45 years old and married, with eight children.

Luzminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Luzminda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns extra income from fish vending.

Luzminda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other goods to sell in her sari-sari (general) store

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 36 years old and single.

He earns a living through flower farming in the Philippines. Ruel is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  He has been farming flowers for four years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Ruel is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to repair and renovate his family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
Anna Liza, 32, is a married woman with two children. She lives in Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

For the past five years Anna Liza has planted, harvested, and sold bananas to earn a living. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP from doing so. Anna Liza has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seed, seedlings, and young plants to raise.

In the future, Anna Liza wants to make improvements on her house and put her children through school.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, seedlings, and young plants to raise.

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Trinidad works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Trinidad is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her fishing business. Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through 15 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fish vending business. Evangeline has been in this business for 23 years. She also earns more income from nipa (palm leaf) weaving.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 61 years old.  She is married and has 7 children. 

Gaudiosa is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Gaudiosa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more livestock to sell.  Gaudiosa has been buying and selling livestock for one year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Gaudiosa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock to sell

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Herminia works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Herminia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing/fish vending business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Porceli

texts.en:
Porceli is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing/fish vending business. Porceli has been in this business for 15 years.  She earns additional income from nipa weaving.  Porceli has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for fishing

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell for her business.

Alona has been in this business for seven years. She also earns income from her sari-sari store.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and send her child to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marveth

texts.en:
Marveth is 39 years old and married to a farmer. To make a living, they plant and harvest rice to sell. They have been involved in this kind of business for eight years. They own a two-hectare rice field. The couple have three children that attend to school. According to her, they should also double their efforts in order to meet all their needs, especially as prices of basic commodities and tuition fees are nowadays increasing. 

As of now, Marveth needs to ensure proper growth of her crop but she has an insufficient fund. She is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and five bags of insecticides used in farming.

Marveth would like to improve their farming practices so that in the future, she can also achieve her goal of making her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and five bags of insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase in-demand clothing for men, women and kids for his clothing sales business

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en: After succeeding at the last loan, Ni Putu is continuing to take out a loan from MUK, The loan will be used to purchase two superior piglets. With the last breed, she earned enough profit to supplement her family income. Because of the business, Ni Putu could provide the needs of her children's education. She hopes she can save more for future needs.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets.

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Ilyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Ilyn became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Ilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Girlie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Girlie became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Girlie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Elizabeth has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Elizabeth became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Marieta provides motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

Marieta became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Marieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Julieta has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Beatriz has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Beatriz has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Beatriz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 10 children. Merlyn has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children. 

Lourdesita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lourdesita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lourdesita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Lilia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, Lilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Vilma has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Gulumkan

texts.ru: Гулумкан 28 лет, замужем и воспитывает двух детей. Гулумкан работает учителем в местной школе на протяжении пяти лет. В 2006 году, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Гулумкан начала свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав стартовую сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS), Гулумкан смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день девять коров, приносящее около 10,000 сом ( KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулумкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. В будущем, Гулумкан планирует увеличивать поголовье скота, чтобы иметь возможность дать образование детям.
texts.en: Gulumkan is 28 years old, she is married and has two children. Gulumkan has been working as a teacher at a local school for five years. In 2006 seeking additional source of funding for her family Gulumkan started her business in breeding of cattle. Using the starting amount of 15,000 soms (KGS) Gulumkan was able to develop her business which at present time amounts to nine cows yielding about 10,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to further develop her business she has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to purchase additional stock. In the future Gulumkan plans to increase the number of cattle to be able to give education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Kang Meas district, Ly is a 32-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are still in school. She has been running a food and grocery store for more than four years as primary business for her family. She sells drinking water, beer, beef soup, boiled duck egg, biscuits, soap, shampoo, etc. With her current business, she earns more than five U.S. dollars per day and saves around two U.S. dollars per day. 

This is Ly’s first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy more beer, drinking water, biscuits, shampoo, etc. for her store. This loan will enable her to increase her business so as to earn a larger income to build on some savings for her future needs and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more drinking water, biscuits, shampoo, etc for her store.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosemarie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en:
Hoy, age 36, is married and has three dependent children. Two of them work for others for a fee while the last one is still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming on her farm twice per year and she supplements her income by growing and selling vegetables and grass once per month. She has been in this business for more than eight years. She earns less than five U.S. dollars per day. 

Hoy is the second cycled client who successfully paid back her loan to VisionFund. After the loan, she has regular income and can set aside some money. Seeing her business is growing, she is now requesting another loan. She will use most of the loan to buy a motorbike to transport grass for sale, and also to buy rice seeds for her farm. 

With this loan she hopes to increase her business and earn a larger income to build on some savings, to make her living conditions even better, and also to keep her kid in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farm and a motorbike to transport grass for sale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Ruby Rose

texts.en:
Ruby Rose is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Ruby Rose has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ruby Rose has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ruby Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Originally from the Prey Chhor district, Huon is now 61 years old. She has struggled to make her living as a farmer for more than 20 years. She has two dependent children. Her daughter works in a garment factory and her other child works in a rice field with her. She earns less than five U.S. dollars per day and saves around three U.S. dollars per day for her current business. 

This is Huon’s first loan with VisionFund. She will use the entire loan to buy rice seeds for her farm and buy a plot of farming land. This loan will enable her to increase her farming and make more rice so as to generate more income to build savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farm and buy a plot of farming land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Janit

texts.en:
Janit is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Janit provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Janit has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Janit hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for her motorcycle transport service.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nimfa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Nimfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nimfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Originally from the Ponhea Krek district, Navy is 41 years old. She is a peasant who has been growing soy beans and cassava for more than five years to make a living. She now earns more than 15 U.S. dollars per day from her current business. 

Navy is the fourth cycled loan client. The previous loans from VisionFund have helped her grow her business. Now she is applying for another loan. She will use it to grow more soy beans and use some of the loan to buy a new ladder for her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her business growing while having a new ladder for her house.

loans.use: to grow more soy beans and buy a new ladder for her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Josephine has a food shop, known in the Philippines as a "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Arlene has a shop that sells fish, such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fish to sell.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Daisy Jepkosgei

texts.en: Daisy is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 6 to 17 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells clothing for young ladies and babies. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the delay of payments from customers. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes to run many more boutiques in the future.
