loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a 50-year-old widowed mother of six children in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district. Three of her children are dependent, and two of them are still in school. Another works as a construction worker. 

As a widowed mother of a big family, Mao has farmed her rice field for twenty years to feed her children. She supplements her income by raising pigs. She earns five USD per day and saves 2.5 USD per day for her business.

Mao and her group member are applying for their first loan with VisionFund. Mao wants to use this loan to buy feed for her pigs. To raise additional income, she also wants to use some of the loan to run a small grocery store in the front yard of her house. She hopes to increase the income of her family to improve their standard of living. She also hopes to set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and run a small grocery store.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mebelyn

texts.en:
Mebelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Mebelyn has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mebelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mebelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Chhaykim

texts.en:
Chhaykim is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming on her cassava plantation for more than ten years, while her husband is a wage worker at the rubber plantation. With her current business, she earns more than five USD per day and saves around three. 

This is Chhaykim's first loan with VisionFund. She will use the entire loan to invest in a plot of land in the village. The land purchase made possible by this loan will enable her to increase the assets available to her children when they grow up.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land in the village.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Marily

texts.en:
Marily is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 

Marily has a shop that sells fish, such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Marily has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a widow with one child. She is 71 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Juliana is a farmer and operates a corn production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years, and every month she earns 10,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

Juliana has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future, Juliana hopes to save some money in reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. In the future, she plans to use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Serafina has a rice field and sells rice grain during harvest season. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for her rice field.

Serafina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Serafina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 25-year-old married woman with no child. She's had a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Nat, 58, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a plastic handbag vendor and her husband is a carpenter. Additionally, her husband produces palm sugar to sell in order to generate extra income to support the family. Her daughter is a garment worker and her son is a construction worker. Nat requests a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital in her business in order to purchase more plastic handbag to resell at the market. She hopes she will finish building her house (shown in the photo) after getting this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic handbag to resell.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 70-years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 10 children. 

Arsenio has a shop that sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Arsenio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arsenio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is from Dalapang, Ozamis City. She is 54-years-old, married, and has 3 school-aged child. 

To make a living Adela has been engaged in planting, harvesting and selling bananas for over 5 years. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Adela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 28-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Marissa has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Marissa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marissa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40-year-old married woman with seven children. Six of them are in school. She has had a business selling food in Yei, South Sudan for one year.

Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and rice. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with eight children. Marciana has a pig farm that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed for the pigs. Marciana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marciana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 40-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Leah, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child, aged 10 years. Jeremiah has been rearing pigs for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Jeremiah will use the loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. He will invest the anticipated profit from the business in the education of his children. 

He hopes to own a big pig farm in the future and become a major supplier of pig products.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional items for her tailoring business.

Connie has been in this business for 7 years. She also earns income from raising pigs.

Connie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Julie has been in this business for three years. She also earns income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 50 years old with nine children.  Two of them attend school.  She is a widow.  She has had a business selling food from a food stall in Yei South Sudan for seven years.
Loice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase greens, oranges and tomatoes.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables to sell at her food stand.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 37-year-old mixed crop farmer.  He is married to Jane who sells fruit. They are blessed with one child who is 4-years-old.  He has been in the farming business for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Patrick will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit, he will expand the business. 

He hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea, 26, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is employed as a garment worker. Her husband is a mechanic. Chea requests a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work. She can easily go to work on time when she has her own transportation. In the future, she would like to renew her house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Yieza

texts.en:
Yieza is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Yieza is married and has three adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Yieza owns and operates a business venture providing construction supplies (such as hallow blocks) to local community members. Yieza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Yieza is requesting a loan of 17,521 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. In 2007, Yieza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided
